translations.literal: Lü Gong from Shanfu was on good terms with the magistrate of Pei. To avoid his enemies, he became the magistrate's guest and settled his family there. When the influential officials and clerks of Pei heard that the magistrate had an important guest, they all came to offer congratulations. Lü Gong replied: "This is not something that mere children and women can understand." In the end, she married Emperor Gaozu. This daughter of Lü Gong would become Empress Lü. translations.text: Empress Lü said: "There are always clouds above where you stay. That's why we can always find you by following them."

sentences.zh: 高祖又喜。

translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu was delighted once more.
translations.text: Emperor Gaozu was delighted once more.

sentences.zh: 沛中子弟或聞之，多欲附者矣。

translations.idiomatic: Some young men from Pei heard about this and many wished to join him.
translations.text: Some young men from Pei heard about this and many wished to join him.

sentences.zh: 於是樊噲從高祖來。

translations.idiomatic: So Fan Kuai came to follow Emperor Gaozu.
translations.text: So Fan Kuai came to follow Emperor Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 沛令後悔，恐其有變，乃閉城城守，欲誅蕭、曹。

translations.idiomatic: The magistrate of Pei later regretted it and feared there would be trouble, so he closed the city gates and defended, wanting to execute Xiao and Cao.
translations.text: The magistrate of Pei later regretted it and feared there would be trouble, so he closed the city gates and defended, wanting to execute Xiao and Cao.

sentences.zh: 蕭、曹恐，踰城保高祖。

translations.idiomatic: Xiao and Cao were afraid, so they climbed over the wall to join Emperor Gaozu.
translations.text: Xiao and Cao were afraid, so they climbed over the wall to join Emperor Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 高祖乃書 帛射城上，與沛父老曰：「天下同苦秦久矣。

translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu then wrote on silk and shot it onto the city wall, saying to the elders of Pei: "All under heaven have suffered under Qin for a long time.
translations.text: Emperor Gaozu then wrote on silk and shot it onto the city wall, saying to the elders of Pei: "All under heaven have suffered under Qin for a long time.

sentences.zh: 今父老雖為沛令守，諸侯並起，今屠沛。

translations.idiomatic: Now although you elders are defending for the magistrate of Pei, the feudal lords are all rising up, and Pei will be massacred.
translations.text: Now although you elders are defending for the magistrate of Pei, the feudal lords are all rising up, and Pei will be massacred.

sentences.zh: 沛今共誅令，擇可立立之，以應諸侯，即室家完。

translations.idiomatic: If Pei now joins together to execute the magistrate and chooses someone worthy to establish as leader to respond to the feudal lords, then your families will be safe.
translations.text: If Pei now joins together to execute the magistrate and chooses someone worthy to establish as leader to respond to the feudal lords, then your families will be safe.

sentences.zh: 不然，父子俱屠，無為 也。」

translations.idiomatic: Otherwise, fathers and sons will all be massacred together. There will be no benefit."
translations.text: Otherwise, fathers and sons will all be massacred together. There will be no benefit."

sentences.zh: 父老乃帥子弟共殺沛令，開城門迎高祖，欲以為沛令。

translations.idiomatic: The elders then led the young men together to kill the magistrate of Pei, opened the city gates to welcome Emperor Gaozu, and wanted to make him magistrate of Pei.
translations.text: The elders then led the young men together to kill the magistrate of Pei, opened the city gates to welcome Emperor Gaozu, and wanted to make him magistrate of Pei.

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「天下方擾，諸侯並起，令置將不善，一敗塗地。

translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu said: "The world is in chaos right now, with feudal lords rising up everywhere. If you appoint a commander who is not capable, one defeat will ruin everything.
translations.text: Emperor Gaozu said: "The world is in chaos right now, with feudal lords rising up everywhere. If you appoint a commander who is not capable, one defeat will ruin everything.

sentences.zh: 吾非敢自愛，恐能薄，不能完父兄子弟。

translations.idiomatic: I'm not trying to protect myself. I'm afraid my abilities are weak and I cannot protect the fathers, brothers, and children.
translations.text: I'm not trying to protect myself. I'm afraid my abilities are weak and I cannot protect the fathers, brothers, and children.

sentences.zh: 此 大事，願吏擇可者。」

translations.idiomatic: This is a major matter. I hope the officials will choose someone suitable."
translations.text: This is a major matter. I hope the officials will choose someone suitable."

sentences.zh: 蕭、曹等皆文吏，自愛，恐事不就，後秦種族其家，盡讓高祖。

translations.idiomatic: Xiao, Cao, and the others were all civil officials who cherished themselves. They feared that if things didn't succeed, Qin would exterminate their families, so they all yielded to Emperor Gaozu.
translations.text: Xiao, Cao, and the others were all civil officials who cherished themselves. They feared that if things didn't succeed, Qin would exterminate their families, so they all yielded to Emperor Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 諸父老皆曰：「平生所聞劉季奇怪，當貴，且卜筮之，莫如劉季最吉。」

translations.idiomatic: All the elders said: "In our lifetime we've heard that Liu Ji is extraordinary and should become noble. Moreover, when we consulted the divination, none was more auspicious than Liu Ji."
translations.text: All the elders said: "In our lifetime we've heard that Liu Ji is extraordinary and should become noble. Moreover, when we consulted the divination, none was more auspicious than Liu Ji."

sentences.zh: 高祖 數讓。

translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu declined repeatedly.
translations.text: Emperor Gaozu declined repeatedly.

sentences.zh: 眾莫肯為，高祖乃立為沛公。

translations.idiomatic: No one else was willing to take it, so Emperor Gaozu was established as Lord of Pei.
translations.text: No one else was willing to take it, so Emperor Gaozu was established as Lord of Pei.

sentences.zh: 祠黃帝，祭蚩尤於沛廷，而釁鼓旗。

translations.idiomatic: He sacrificed to the Yellow Emperor and made offerings to Chiyou in the Pei court, and smeared blood on the drums and flags.
translations.text: He sacrificed to the Yellow Emperor and made offerings to Chiyou in the Pei court, and smeared blood on the drums and flags.

sentences.zh: 幟皆赤，由所殺蛇白帝子，所殺者赤帝子故也。

translations.idiomatic: All the banners were red, because the snake he killed was the son of the White Emperor, and the one who killed it was the son of the Red Emperor.
translations.text: All the banners were red, because the snake he killed was the son of the White Emperor, and the one who killed it was the son of the Red Emperor.

sentences.zh: 於是少年豪吏如蕭、曹、樊噲等皆為收沛子 弟，得三千人。

translations.idiomatic: So the young brave officials like Xiao, Cao, Fan Kuai, and others all recruited young men from Pei and gathered three thousand.
translations.text: So the young brave officials like Xiao, Cao, Fan Kuai, and others all recruited young men from Pei and gathered three thousand.

sentences.zh: 是月，項梁與兄子羽起吳。

translations.idiomatic: In this month, Xiang Liang and his brother's son Yu rose up in Wu.
translations.text: In this month, Xiang Liang and his brother's son Yu rose up in Wu.

sentences.zh: 田儋與從弟榮、橫起齊，自立為齊王。

translations.idiomatic: Tian Dan and his younger brothers Rong and Heng rose up in Qi, establishing themselves as King of Qi.
translations.text: Tian Dan and his younger brothers Rong and Heng rose up in Qi, establishing themselves as King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 韓廣自立為燕王。

translations.idiomatic: Han Guang established himself as King of Yan.
translations.text: Han Guang established himself as King of Yan.

sentences.zh: 魏咎自立為魏王。

translations.idiomatic: Wei Jiu established himself as King of Wei.
translations.text: Wei Jiu established himself as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 陳涉之將周章西入關，至戲，秦將章邯距破之。

translations.idiomatic: Chen She's general Zhou Zhang marched west into the pass and reached Xi, where Qin general Zhang Han opposed and defeated him.
translations.text: Chen She's general Zhou Zhang marched west into the pass and reached Xi, where Qin general Zhang Han opposed and defeated him.

sentences.zh: 秦二年十月，沛公攻胡陵、方與，還守豐。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of the second year of Qin, Pei Gong attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, then returned to defend Feng.
translations.text: In the tenth month of the second year of Qin, Pei Gong attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, then returned to defend Feng.

sentences.zh: 秦泗川監平將兵圍豐。

translations.idiomatic: The Qin governor of Si River Ping led troops to besiege Feng.
translations.text: The Qin governor of Si River Ping led troops to besiege Feng.

sentences.zh: 二日，出與戰，破之。

translations.idiomatic: For two days they came out to battle and defeated him.
translations.text: For two days they came out to battle and defeated him.

sentences.zh: 令雍齒守豐。

translations.idiomatic: He ordered Yong Chi to defend Feng.
translations.text: He ordered Yong Chi to defend Feng.

sentences.zh: 十 一月，沛公引兵之薜。

translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Pei Gong led troops to Xue.
translations.text: In the eleventh month, Pei Gong led troops to Xue.

sentences.zh: 秦泗川守壯兵敗於薛，走至戚，沛公左司馬得殺之。

translations.idiomatic: The Qin governor of Si River Zhuang was defeated at Xue and fled to Qi, where Pei Gong's left commander Sima De killed him.
translations.text: The Qin governor of Si River Zhuang was defeated at Xue and fled to Qi, where Pei Gong's left commander Sima De killed him.

sentences.zh: 沛公還軍亢父，至方與。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong returned his army to Kangfu and arrived at Fang Yu.
translations.text: Pei Gong returned his army to Kangfu and arrived at Fang Yu.

sentences.zh: 趙王武臣為其將所殺。

translations.idiomatic: King Wu of Zhao was killed by his own general.
translations.text: King Wu of Zhao was killed by his own general.

sentences.zh: 十二月，楚王陳涉為其御莊賈所殺。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, King Chen She of Chu was killed by his charioteer Zhuang Jia.
translations.text: In the twelfth month, King Chen She of Chu was killed by his charioteer Zhuang Jia.

sentences.zh: 魏人 周市略地豐沛，使人謂雍齒曰：「豐，故梁徙也，今魏地已定者數十城。

translations.idiomatic: The Wei man Zhou Shi seized territory in Feng and Pei, and sent someone to tell Yong Chi: "Feng was originally Liang territory, now Wei has already pacified dozens of cities.
translations.text: The Wei man Zhou Shi seized territory in Feng and Pei, and sent someone to tell Yong Chi: "Feng was originally Liang territory, now Wei has already pacified dozens of cities.

sentences.zh: 齒今下魏，魏以齒為侯守豐；

translations.idiomatic: If Chi now submits to Wei, Wei will make Chi a marquess to guard Feng;
translations.text: If Chi now submits to Wei, Wei will make Chi a marquess to guard Feng;

sentences.zh: 不下，且屠豐。」

translations.idiomatic: if he doesn't submit, Wei will massacre Feng."
translations.text: if he doesn't submit, Wei will massacre Feng."

sentences.zh: 雍齒雅不欲屬沛公，及魏招之，即反為魏守 豐。

translations.idiomatic: Yong Chi had long not wanted to serve Pei Gong, and when Wei summoned him, he immediately rebelled and defended Feng for Wei.
translations.text: Yong Chi had long not wanted to serve Pei Gong, and when Wei summoned him, he immediately rebelled and defended Feng for Wei.

sentences.zh: 沛公攻豐，不能取。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong attacked Feng but could not capture it.
translations.text: Pei Gong attacked Feng but could not capture it.

sentences.zh: 沛公還之沛，怨雍齒與豐子弟畔之。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong returned to Pei, resentful that Yong Chi and the young men of Feng had rebelled against him.
translations.text: Pei Gong returned to Pei, resentful that Yong Chi and the young men of Feng had rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 正月，張耳等立趙後趙歇為趙王。

translations.idiomatic: In the first month, Zhang Er and others established Zhao's former king Zhao Xie as King of Zhao.
translations.text: In the first month, Zhang Er and others established Zhao's former king Zhao Xie as King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 東陽甯君、秦嘉立景駒為楚王，在留。

translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Dongyang Ning and Qin Jia established Jing Ju as King of Chu, stationed at Liu.
translations.text: The Lord of Dongyang Ning and Qin Jia established Jing Ju as King of Chu, stationed at Liu.

sentences.zh: 沛公往從之，道得張良，遂與俱 見景駒，請兵以攻豐。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong went to join him, met Zhang Liang along the way, and together they went to see Jing Ju, requesting troops to attack Feng.
translations.text: Pei Gong went to join him, met Zhang Liang along the way, and together they went to see Jing Ju, requesting troops to attack Feng.

sentences.zh: 時章邯從陳，別將司馬镛將兵北定楚地，屠相，至碭。

translations.idiomatic: At this time, Zhang Han was pursuing Chen, while his deputy general Sima Yiou led troops north to pacify Chu territory, massacring Xiang and reaching Dang.
translations.text: At this time, Zhang Han was pursuing Chen, while his deputy general Sima Yiou led troops north to pacify Chu territory, massacring Xiang and reaching Dang.

sentences.zh: 東陽甯君、沛公引兵西，與戰蕭西，不利，還收兵聚留。

translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Dongyang Ning and Pei Gong led troops west and battled west of Xiao, but were unsuccessful, so they retreated and gathered troops at Liu.
translations.text: The Lord of Dongyang Ning and Pei Gong led troops west and battled west of Xiao, but were unsuccessful, so they retreated and gathered troops at Liu.

sentences.zh: 二月，攻碭，三日拔之。

translations.idiomatic: In the second month, they attacked Dang and captured it after three days.
translations.text: In the second month, they attacked Dang and captured it after three days.

sentences.zh: 收碭 兵，得六千人，與故合九千人。

translations.idiomatic: They recruited troops from Dang, getting six thousand men, and together with the previous troops made nine thousand.
translations.text: They recruited troops from Dang, getting six thousand men, and together with the previous troops made nine thousand.

sentences.zh: 三月，攻下邑，拔之。

translations.idiomatic: In the third month, they attacked Xiayi and captured it.
translations.text: In the third month, they attacked Xiayi and captured it.

sentences.zh: 還擊豐，不下。

translations.idiomatic: They returned to attack Feng, but could not capture it.
translations.text: They returned to attack Feng, but could not capture it.

sentences.zh: 四月，項梁擊殺景駒、秦嘉，止薛，沛公往見之。

translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, Xiang Liang attacked and killed Jing Ju and Qin Jia, then stopped at Xue. Pei Gong went to see him.
translations.text: In the fourth month, Xiang Liang attacked and killed Jing Ju and Qin Jia, then stopped at Xue. Pei Gong went to see him.

sentences.zh: 項梁益沛公卒五千人，五大夫將十人。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang increased Pei Gong's troops by five thousand men and ten generals of the rank of Grand Master.
translations.text: Xiang Liang increased Pei Gong's troops by five thousand men and ten generals of the rank of Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 沛公 還，引兵攻豐，拔之。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong returned and led troops to attack Feng, capturing it.
translations.text: Pei Gong returned and led troops to attack Feng, capturing it.

sentences.zh: 雍齒奔魏。

translations.idiomatic: Yong Chi fled to Wei.
translations.text: Yong Chi fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 五月，項羽拔襄城還。

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, Xiang Yu captured Xiangcheng and returned.
translations.text: In the fifth month, Xiang Yu captured Xiangcheng and returned.

sentences.zh: 項梁盡召別將。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang summoned all his deputy generals.
translations.text: Xiang Liang summoned all his deputy generals.

sentences.zh: 六月，沛公如薛，與項梁共立楚懷王孫心為楚懷王。

translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, Pei Gong went to Xue and together with Xiang Liang established Chu King Huai's grandson Xin as King Huai of Chu.
translations.text: In the sixth month, Pei Gong went to Xue and together with Xiang Liang established Chu King Huai's grandson Xin as King Huai of Chu.

sentences.zh: 章邯破殺魏王 咎、齊王田儋於臨濟。

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han defeated and killed King Jiu of Wei and King Tian Dan of Qi at Linji.
translations.text: Zhang Han defeated and killed King Jiu of Wei and King Tian Dan of Qi at Linji.

sentences.zh: 七月，大霖雨。

translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month, there was heavy continuous rain.
translations.text: In the seventh month, there was heavy continuous rain.

sentences.zh: 沛公攻亢父。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong attacked Kangfu.
translations.text: Pei Gong attacked Kangfu.

sentences.zh: 章邯圍田榮於東阿。

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han besieged Tian Rong at Dong'e.
translations.text: Zhang Han besieged Tian Rong at Dong'e.

sentences.zh: 沛公與項梁共救田榮，大破章邯東阿。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong and Xiang Liang together went to rescue Tian Rong and greatly defeated Zhang Han at Dong'e.
translations.text: Pei Gong and Xiang Liang together went to rescue Tian Rong and greatly defeated Zhang Han at Dong'e.

sentences.zh: 田榮歸，沛公、項羽追北，至城陽，攻屠其城。

translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong returned. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu pursued the defeated enemy north to Chengyang and attacked, massacring the population of the city.
translations.text: Tian Rong returned. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu pursued the defeated enemy north to Chengyang and attacked, massacring the population of the city.

sentences.zh: 軍濮 陽東，復與章邯戰，又破之。

translations.idiomatic: The army encamped east of Puyang and again battled Zhang Han, defeating him once more.
translations.text: The army encamped east of Puyang and again battled Zhang Han, defeating him once more.

sentences.zh: 章邯復振，守濮陽，環水。

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han recovered his strength and defended Puyang, surrounding it with water.
translations.text: Zhang Han recovered his strength and defended Puyang, surrounding it with water.

sentences.zh: 沛公、項羽去攻定陶。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong and Xiang Yu left to attack Dingtao.
translations.text: Pei Gong and Xiang Yu left to attack Dingtao.

sentences.zh: 八月，田榮立田儋子市為齊王。

translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Tian Rong established Tian Dan's son Shi as King of Qi.
translations.text: In the eighth month, Tian Rong established Tian Dan's son Shi as King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 定陶未下，沛公與項羽西略地至雍丘，與秦軍戰，大敗之，斬三川守李由。

translations.idiomatic: Dingtao had not yet fallen. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu marched west to seize territory as far as Yongqiu, where they battled Qin troops and greatly defeated them, beheading the governor of Sanchuan, Li You.
translations.text: Dingtao had not yet fallen. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu marched west to seize territory as far as Yongqiu, where they battled Qin troops and greatly defeated them, beheading the governor of Sanchuan, Li You.

sentences.zh: 還攻外黃，外黃未下。

translations.idiomatic: They returned to attack Waihuang, but Waihuang did not fall.
translations.text: They returned to attack Waihuang, but Waihuang did not fall.

sentences.zh: 項梁再破秦軍，有驕色。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang defeated the Qin army again and showed arrogant bearing.
translations.text: Xiang Liang defeated the Qin army again and showed arrogant bearing.

sentences.zh: 宋義諫，不聽。

translations.idiomatic: Song Yi advised against it, but Xiang Liang did not listen.
translations.text: Song Yi advised against it, but Xiang Liang did not listen.

sentences.zh: 秦益章邯兵。

translations.idiomatic: Qin increased Zhang Han's troops.
translations.text: Qin increased Zhang Han's troops.

sentences.zh: 九月，章邯夜銜枚擊項梁定陶，大破之，殺項梁。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, Zhang Han bit on wooden sticks and attacked Xiang Liang at Dingtao by night, greatly defeating him and killing Xiang Liang.
translations.text: In the ninth month, Zhang Han bit on wooden sticks and attacked Xiang Liang at Dingtao by night, greatly defeating him and killing Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 時連雨自七月至九月。

translations.idiomatic: At this time there was continuous rain from the seventh month until the ninth month.
translations.text: At this time there was continuous rain from the seventh month until the ninth month.

sentences.zh: 沛公、項羽方攻陳留，聞梁死，士卒恐，乃與將軍呂臣引兵而東，徙懷王自盱台都彭城。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong and Xiang Yu were attacking Chenliu when they heard of Liang's death. The soldiers were terrified, so they joined with General Lü Chen and led troops east, moving King Huai from Xutai to Pengcheng as the capital.
translations.text: Pei Gong and Xiang Yu were attacking Chenliu when they heard of Liang's death. The soldiers were terrified, so they joined with General Lü Chen and led troops east, moving King Huai from Xutai to Pengcheng as the capital.

sentences.zh: 呂臣軍彭城東，項羽軍彭城西，沛公軍碭。

translations.idiomatic: Lü Chen's army was stationed east of Pengcheng, Xiang Yu's army west of Pengcheng, and Pei Gong's army at Dang.
translations.text: Lü Chen's army was stationed east of Pengcheng, Xiang Yu's army west of Pengcheng, and Pei Gong's army at Dang.

sentences.zh: 魏咎弟豹 自立為魏王。

translations.idiomatic: Wei Jiu's younger brother Bao established himself as King of Wei.
translations.text: Wei Jiu's younger brother Bao established himself as King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 後九月，懷王并呂臣、項羽軍自將之。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month afterward, King Huai combined Lü Chen and Xiang Yu's armies and personally took command.
translations.text: In the ninth month afterward, King Huai combined Lü Chen and Xiang Yu's armies and personally took command.

sentences.zh: 以沛公為碭郡長，封武安侯，將碭郡兵。

translations.idiomatic: He appointed Pei Gong as governor of Dang commandery, enfeoffed him as Marquis of Wuan, and put him in command of Dang commandery troops.
translations.text: He appointed Pei Gong as governor of Dang commandery, enfeoffed him as Marquis of Wuan, and put him in command of Dang commandery troops.

sentences.zh: 以羽為魯公，封長安侯，呂臣為司徒，其父呂青為令尹。

translations.idiomatic: He appointed Yu as Duke of Lu and enfeoffed him as Marquis of Chang'an. Lü Chen became Minister of Works, and his father Lü Qing became Prime Minister.
translations.text: He appointed Yu as Duke of Lu and enfeoffed him as Marquis of Chang'an. Lü Chen became Minister of Works, and his father Lü Qing became Prime Minister.

sentences.zh: 章邯已破項梁，以為楚地兵不足憂，乃渡河北擊趙王歇，大破之。

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han had already defeated Xiang Liang and thought that the Chu region's troops were not worth worrying about, so he crossed north of the Yellow River to attack King Xie of Zhao, greatly defeating him.
translations.text: Zhang Han had already defeated Xiang Liang and thought that the Chu region's troops were not worth worrying about, so he crossed north of the Yellow River to attack King Xie of Zhao, greatly defeating him.

sentences.zh: 歇保鉅鹿城，秦將王離圍之。

translations.idiomatic: Xie defended the city of Julu, where Qin general Wang Li besieged him.
translations.text: Xie defended the city of Julu, where Qin general Wang Li besieged him.

sentences.zh: 趙數請救，懷王乃以宋義為上將，項羽為次將，范增為末將，北救趙。

translations.idiomatic: Zhao repeatedly requested rescue, so King Huai appointed Song Yi as supreme commander, Xiang Yu as deputy commander, and Fan Zeng as rear commander, to go north and rescue Zhao.
translations.text: Zhao repeatedly requested rescue, so King Huai appointed Song Yi as supreme commander, Xiang Yu as deputy commander, and Fan Zeng as rear commander, to go north and rescue Zhao.

sentences.zh: 初，懷王與諸將約，先入定關中者王之。

translations.idiomatic: Initially, King Huai had made an agreement with the generals that whoever first entered and pacified Guanzhong would be made king of it.
translations.text: Initially, King Huai had made an agreement with the generals that whoever first entered and pacified Guanzhong would be made king of it.

sentences.zh: 當是時，秦兵彊，常乘勝逐北，諸將莫利先入關。

translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qin troops were strong and often took advantage of victories to pursue defeated enemies. None of the generals saw benefit in being the first to enter the pass.
translations.text: At this time, Qin troops were strong and often took advantage of victories to pursue defeated enemies. None of the generals saw benefit in being the first to enter the pass.

sentences.zh: 獨羽怨秦破項 梁，奮勢，願與沛公西入關。

translations.idiomatic: Only Xiang Yu resented Qin for defeating Xiang Liang and was eager to go west into the pass with Pei Gong.
translations.text: Only Xiang Yu resented Qin for defeating Xiang Liang and was eager to go west into the pass with Pei Gong.

sentences.zh: 懷王諸老將皆曰：「項羽為人慓悍禍賊，嘗攻襄城，襄城無唣類，所過無不殘滅。

translations.idiomatic: King Huai's veteran generals all said: "Xiang Yu is fierce and violent, a man of disaster. He once attacked Xiangcheng, leaving no survivors in Xiangcheng. Wherever he passes, nothing is left undestroyed.
translations.text: King Huai's veteran generals all said: "Xiang Yu is fierce and violent, a man of disaster. He once attacked Xiangcheng, leaving no survivors in Xiangcheng. Wherever he passes, nothing is left undestroyed.

sentences.zh: 且楚數進取，前陳王、項梁皆敗，不如更遣長者扶義 而西，告諭秦父兄。

translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Chu has repeatedly advanced but the former King Chen and Xiang Liang both failed. It would be better to send an elder who upholds righteousness to go west and inform the fathers and brothers of Qin.
translations.text: Moreover, Chu has repeatedly advanced but the former King Chen and Xiang Liang both failed. It would be better to send an elder who upholds righteousness to go west and inform the fathers and brothers of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦父兄苦其主久矣，今誠得長者往，毋侵暴，宜可下。

translations.idiomatic: The fathers and brothers of Qin have suffered under their ruler for a long time. Now if we truly send an elder, without invasion or violence, the region should submit.
translations.text: The fathers and brothers of Qin have suffered under their ruler for a long time. Now if we truly send an elder, without invasion or violence, the region should submit.

sentences.zh: 項羽不可遣，獨沛公素寬大長者。」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu should not be sent. Only Pei Gong is habitually magnanimous and an elder."
translations.text: Xiang Yu should not be sent. Only Pei Gong is habitually magnanimous and an elder."

sentences.zh: 卒不許羽，而遣沛公西收陳王、項梁散卒。

translations.idiomatic: In the end they did not permit Xiang Yu, but sent Pei Gong west to gather the scattered troops of King Chen and Xiang Liang.
translations.text: In the end they did not permit Xiang Yu, but sent Pei Gong west to gather the scattered troops of King Chen and Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 乃道碭至 陽城與杠里，攻秦軍壁，破其二軍。

translations.idiomatic: So he went by way of Dang to Yangcheng and Gangli, attacked Qin army fortifications, and broke two of their armies.
translations.text: So he went by way of Dang to Yangcheng and Gangli, attacked Qin army fortifications, and broke two of their armies.

sentences.zh: 秦三年十月，齊將田都畔田榮，將兵助項羽救趙。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of the third year of Qin, Qi general Tian Du rebelled against Tian Rong and led troops to help Xiang Yu rescue Zhao.
translations.text: In the tenth month of the third year of Qin, Qi general Tian Du rebelled against Tian Rong and led troops to help Xiang Yu rescue Zhao.

sentences.zh: 沛公攻破東郡尉於成武。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong attacked and defeated the Dongjun prefect at Chengwu.
translations.text: Pei Gong attacked and defeated the Dongjun prefect at Chengwu.

sentences.zh: 十一月，項羽殺宋義，并其兵 渡河，自立為上將軍，諸將黥布等皆屬。

translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Xiang Yu killed Song Yi and took his troops, crossed the river, and established himself as supreme commander. Generals like Ying Bu and others all came under his command.
translations.text: In the eleventh month, Xiang Yu killed Song Yi and took his troops, crossed the river, and established himself as supreme commander. Generals like Ying Bu and others all came under his command.

sentences.zh: 十二月，沛公引兵至栗，遇剛武侯，奪其軍四千餘人，并之，與魏將皇欣、武滿軍合，攻秦軍，破之。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, Pei Gong led troops to Li and encountered Gangwu Marquis, seized over four thousand of his men, and combined them. He joined with Wei generals Huang Xin and Wu Man's army and attacked Qin troops, defeating them.
translations.text: In the twelfth month, Pei Gong led troops to Li and encountered Gangwu Marquis, seized over four thousand of his men, and combined them. He joined with Wei generals Huang Xin and Wu Man's army and attacked Qin troops, defeating them.

sentences.zh: 故齊王建孫田安下濟 北，從項羽救趙。

translations.idiomatic: Former Qi King Jian's grandson Tian An captured Jibei and followed Xiang Yu to rescue Zhao.
translations.text: Former Qi King Jian's grandson Tian An captured Jibei and followed Xiang Yu to rescue Zhao.

sentences.zh: 羽大破秦軍鉅鹿下，虜王離，走章邯。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu greatly defeated the Qin army at Julu, captured Wang Li, and drove away Zhang Han.
translations.text: Xiang Yu greatly defeated the Qin army at Julu, captured Wang Li, and drove away Zhang Han.

sentences.zh: 二月，沛公從碭北攻昌邑，遇彭越。

translations.idiomatic: In the second month, Pei Gong from north of Dang attacked Changyi and encountered Peng Yue.
translations.text: In the second month, Pei Gong from north of Dang attacked Changyi and encountered Peng Yue.

sentences.zh: 越助攻昌邑，未下。

translations.idiomatic: Yue helped attack Changyi, but it did not fall.
translations.text: Yue helped attack Changyi, but it did not fall.

sentences.zh: 沛公西過高陽，酈食其為里監門，曰：「諸將過 此者多，吾視沛公大度。」

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong passed west through Gaoyang. Li Yiji was the village gatekeeper and said: "Many generals have passed through here. I can see that Pei Gong has great magnanimity."
translations.text: Pei Gong passed west through Gaoyang. Li Yiji was the village gatekeeper and said: "Many generals have passed through here. I can see that Pei Gong has great magnanimity."

sentences.zh: 乃求見沛公。

translations.idiomatic: So he sought to see Pei Gong.
translations.text: So he sought to see Pei Gong.

sentences.zh: 沛公方踞床，使兩女子洗。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong was sitting cross-legged on a bed, having two women wash his feet.
translations.text: Pei Gong was sitting cross-legged on a bed, having two women wash his feet.

sentences.zh: 酈生不拜，長揖曰：「足下必欲誅無道秦，不宜踞見長者。」

translations.idiomatic: Li Sheng did not bow but gave a deep bow and said: "If you truly wish to execute the tyrannical Qin, you should not sit cross-legged when receiving elders."
translations.text: Li Sheng did not bow but gave a deep bow and said: "If you truly wish to execute the tyrannical Qin, you should not sit cross-legged when receiving elders."

sentences.zh: 於是沛公起，攝衣謝之，延上坐。

translations.idiomatic: So Pei Gong rose, straightened his clothes, and apologized. He invited him to sit in the honored position.
translations.text: So Pei Gong rose, straightened his clothes, and apologized. He invited him to sit in the honored position.

sentences.zh: 食其說沛公襲陳留。

translations.idiomatic: Yiji persuaded Pei Gong to attack Chenliu by surprise.
translations.text: Yiji persuaded Pei Gong to attack Chenliu by surprise.

sentences.zh: 沛公以為廣野君，以其弟商為將，將陳留兵。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong made him Lord Guangye and appointed his younger brother Shang as general, commanding the Chenliu troops.
translations.text: Pei Gong made him Lord Guangye and appointed his younger brother Shang as general, commanding the Chenliu troops.

sentences.zh: 三月，攻開封，未拔。

translations.idiomatic: In the third month, they attacked Kaifeng but failed to capture it.
translations.text: In the third month, they attacked Kaifeng but failed to capture it.

sentences.zh: 西與秦將楊熊會戰白馬，又戰曲遇東，大破之。

translations.idiomatic: They met Qin general Yang Xiong in battle at Baima to the west, and again at Quyu to the east, greatly defeating him.
translations.text: They met Qin general Yang Xiong in battle at Baima to the west, and again at Quyu to the east, greatly defeating him.

sentences.zh: 楊熊走之滎陽，二世使使斬 之以徇。

translations.idiomatic: Yang Xiong fled to Xingyang. The Second Emperor sent an envoy to execute him as a warning to others.
translations.text: Yang Xiong fled to Xingyang. The Second Emperor sent an envoy to execute him as a warning to others.

sentences.zh: 四月，南攻潁川，屠之。

translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, they attacked Yingchuan to the south and massacred the population.
translations.text: In the fourth month, they attacked Yingchuan to the south and massacred the population.

sentences.zh: 因張良遂略韓地。

translations.idiomatic: Through Zhang Liang, they then seized the lands of Han.
translations.text: Through Zhang Liang, they then seized the lands of Han.

sentences.zh: 時趙別將司馬卬方欲渡河入關，沛公乃北攻平陰，絕河津。

translations.idiomatic: At this time, the Zhao general Sima Ang was about to cross the river into the passes. Pei Gong attacked Beiyin to the north and cut off the river crossings.
translations.text: At this time, the Zhao general Sima Ang was about to cross the river into the passes. Pei Gong attacked Beiyin to the north and cut off the river crossings.

sentences.zh: 南，戰雒陽東，軍不利，從轘轅至陽城，收軍 中馬騎。

translations.idiomatic: To the south, they fought east of Luoyang. The battle went badly. They retreated from Huan Pass to Yangcheng and gathered cavalry from among the troops.
translations.text: To the south, they fought east of Luoyang. The battle went badly. They retreated from Huan Pass to Yangcheng and gathered cavalry from among the troops.

sentences.zh: 六月，與南陽守齮戰犨東，大破之。

translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, they fought Nanyang governor Yin east of Chu, greatly defeating him.
translations.text: In the sixth month, they fought Nanyang governor Yin east of Chu, greatly defeating him.

sentences.zh: 略南陽郡，南陽守走，保城守宛。

translations.idiomatic: They seized Nanyang commandery. The Nanyang governor fled and defended the city of Wan.
translations.text: They seized Nanyang commandery. The Nanyang governor fled and defended the city of Wan.

sentences.zh: 沛公引兵過宛西。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong led his troops west past Wan.
translations.text: Pei Gong led his troops west past Wan.

sentences.zh: 張良諫曰：「沛公雖欲急入關，秦兵尚眾，距險。

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang advised: "Although Pei Gong wishes to rush into the passes, the Qin troops are still numerous and hold the dangerous passes.
translations.text: Zhang Liang advised: "Although Pei Gong wishes to rush into the passes, the Qin troops are still numerous and hold the dangerous passes.

sentences.zh: 今不下宛，宛從 後擊，彊秦在前，此危道也。」

translations.idiomatic: If we do not take Wan now, Wan will attack from behind while the strong Qin face us ahead. This is a dangerous path."
translations.text: If we do not take Wan now, Wan will attack from behind while the strong Qin face us ahead. This is a dangerous path."

sentences.zh: 於是沛公乃夜引軍從他道還，偃旗幟，遲明，圍宛城三匝。

translations.idiomatic: So Pei Gong led his army back by another route at night, hid his banners, and at dawn surrounded Wan city three times.
translations.text: So Pei Gong led his army back by another route at night, hid his banners, and at dawn surrounded Wan city three times.

sentences.zh: 南陽守欲自剄，其舍人陳恢曰：「死未晚也。」

translations.idiomatic: The Nanyang governor was about to commit suicide, but his aide Chen Hei said: "It is not yet time to die."
translations.text: The Nanyang governor was about to commit suicide, but his aide Chen Hei said: "It is not yet time to die."

sentences.zh: 乃踰城見沛公，曰：「臣 聞足下約先入咸陽者王之，今足下留守宛。

translations.idiomatic: So he climbed over the wall to see Pei Gong and said: "I have heard that you promised to enfeoff as king whoever first entered Xianyang. Now you remain besieging Wan.
translations.text: So he climbed over the wall to see Pei Gong and said: "I have heard that you promised to enfeoff as king whoever first entered Xianyang. Now you remain besieging Wan.

sentences.zh: 宛郡縣連城數十，其吏民自以為降必死，故皆堅守乘城。

translations.idiomatic: Wan commandery has dozens of walled cities connected together. Its officials and people believe they will certainly die if they surrender, so they all defend their walls firmly.
translations.text: Wan commandery has dozens of walled cities connected together. Its officials and people believe they will certainly die if they surrender, so they all defend their walls firmly.

sentences.zh: 今足下盡日止攻，士死傷者必多；

translations.idiomatic: If you continue attacking all day, your soldiers who die and are wounded will certainly be many;
translations.text: If you continue attacking all day, your soldiers who die and are wounded will certainly be many;

sentences.zh: 引兵去宛，宛必隨足下。

translations.idiomatic: Lead your troops away from Wan, and Wan will certainly follow you."
translations.text: Lead your troops away from Wan, and Wan will certainly follow you."

sentences.zh: 足下 前則失咸陽之約，後有彊宛之患。

translations.idiomatic: Ahead you lose the agreement about Xianyang, behind you have the danger of strong Wan.
translations.text: Ahead you lose the agreement about Xianyang, behind you have the danger of strong Wan.

sentences.zh: 為足下計，莫若約降，封其守，因使止守，引其甲卒與之西。

translations.idiomatic: For your sake, it would be better to make a treaty for surrender, enfeoff the governor, and then order him to remain as governor, leading his armored troops west with you.
translations.text: For your sake, it would be better to make a treaty for surrender, enfeoff the governor, and then order him to remain as governor, leading his armored troops west with you.

sentences.zh: 諸城未下者，聞聲爭開門而待足下，足下通行無所累。」

translations.idiomatic: The cities that have not yet surrendered will hear of this and compete to open their gates waiting for you. You will pass through without hindrance."
translations.text: The cities that have not yet surrendered will hear of this and compete to open their gates waiting for you. You will pass through without hindrance."

sentences.zh: 沛公曰： 「善。」

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong said: "Excellent."
translations.text: Pei Gong said: "Excellent."

sentences.zh: 七月，南陽守齮降，封為殷侯，封陳恢千戶。

translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month, Nanyang governor Yin surrendered. He was enfeoffed as Lord Yin, and Chen Hei was enfeoffed with a thousand households.
translations.text: In the seventh month, Nanyang governor Yin surrendered. He was enfeoffed as Lord Yin, and Chen Hei was enfeoffed with a thousand households.

sentences.zh: 引兵西，無不下者。

translations.idiomatic: He led troops west, and there was no city that did not surrender.
translations.text: He led troops west, and there was no city that did not surrender.

sentences.zh: 至丹水，高武侯鰓、襄侯王陵降。

translations.idiomatic: He reached Danshui. Lord Gaowu Gai and Lord Xiang Wang Ling surrendered.
translations.text: He reached Danshui. Lord Gaowu Gai and Lord Xiang Wang Ling surrendered.

sentences.zh: 還攻胡陽，遇番君別將梅鋗，與偕攻析、酈，皆降。

translations.idiomatic: Returning to attack Huyang, he encountered Fan Jun's separate general Mei Zhu, and together they attacked Xi and Li, all of which surrendered.
translations.text: Returning to attack Huyang, he encountered Fan Jun's separate general Mei Zhu, and together they attacked Xi and Li, all of which surrendered.

sentences.zh: 所 過毋得鹵掠，秦民喜。

translations.idiomatic: Wherever they passed, they did not plunder. The Qin people rejoiced.
translations.text: Wherever they passed, they did not plunder. The Qin people rejoiced.

sentences.zh: 遣魏人甯昌使秦。

translations.idiomatic: He sent the Wei man Ning Chang as envoy to Qin.
translations.text: He sent the Wei man Ning Chang as envoy to Qin.

sentences.zh: 是月章邯舉軍降項羽，羽以為雍王。

translations.idiomatic: In this month, Zhang Han led his entire army to surrender to Xiang Yu, who enfeoffed him as King of Yong.
translations.text: In this month, Zhang Han led his entire army to surrender to Xiang Yu, who enfeoffed him as King of Yong.

sentences.zh: 瑕丘申陽下河南。

translations.idiomatic: Xiaqiu Shen Yang took Henan.
translations.text: Xiaqiu Shen Yang took Henan.

sentences.zh: 八月，沛公攻武關，入秦。

translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Pei Gong attacked Wuguan and entered Qin.
translations.text: In the eighth month, Pei Gong attacked Wuguan and entered Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦相趙高恐，乃殺二世，使人來，欲約分王關中，沛公不許。

translations.idiomatic: Qin chancellor Zhao Gao became fearful, so he killed the Second Emperor and sent people to try to make a treaty to divide the kingship of Guanzhong. Pei Gong did not agree.
translations.text: Qin chancellor Zhao Gao became fearful, so he killed the Second Emperor and sent people to try to make a treaty to divide the kingship of Guanzhong. Pei Gong did not agree.

sentences.zh: 九月，趙高立二 世兄子子嬰為秦王。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, Zhao Gao established the Second Emperor's younger brother Zi Ying as King of Qin.
translations.text: In the ninth month, Zhao Gao established the Second Emperor's younger brother Zi Ying as King of Qin.

sentences.zh: 子嬰誅滅趙高，遣將將兵距嶢關。

translations.idiomatic: Zi Ying executed Zhao Gao and sent generals leading troops to defend Yao Pass.
translations.text: Zi Ying executed Zhao Gao and sent generals leading troops to defend Yao Pass.

sentences.zh: 沛公欲擊之，張良曰：「秦兵尚彊，未可輕。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong wanted to attack them. Zhang Liang said: "The Qin troops are still strong. We cannot be careless.
translations.text: Pei Gong wanted to attack them. Zhang Liang said: "The Qin troops are still strong. We cannot be careless.

sentences.zh: 願先遣人益張旗幟於山上為疑兵，使酈食其、陸賈往說秦將，啗 以利。」

translations.idiomatic: I wish to first send people to increase banners on the mountains as feigned troops, and have Li Yiji and Lu Jia go persuade the Qin generals, enticing them with benefits."
translations.text: I wish to first send people to increase banners on the mountains as feigned troops, and have Li Yiji and Lu Jia go persuade the Qin generals, enticing them with benefits."

sentences.zh: 秦將果欲連和，沛公欲許之。

translations.idiomatic: The Qin general indeed wanted to form an alliance. Pei Gong wanted to agree.
translations.text: The Qin general indeed wanted to form an alliance. Pei Gong wanted to agree.

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「此獨其將欲叛，恐其士卒不從，不如因其怠懈擊之。」

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang said: "This is only their general who wants to rebel. He fears his soldiers will not follow. It would be better to take advantage of their laxness and attack them."
translations.text: Zhang Liang said: "This is only their general who wants to rebel. He fears his soldiers will not follow. It would be better to take advantage of their laxness and attack them."

sentences.zh: 沛公引兵繞嶢關，踰蕢山，擊秦軍，大破之藍田南。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong led his troops around Yao Pass, crossed Mount Qi, attacked the Qin army, and greatly defeated them south of Lantian.
translations.text: Pei Gong led his troops around Yao Pass, crossed Mount Qi, attacked the Qin army, and greatly defeated them south of Lantian.

sentences.zh: 遂至藍 田，又戰其北，秦兵大敗。

translations.idiomatic: He then reached Lantian and fought again to its north. The Qin troops suffered a great defeat.
translations.text: He then reached Lantian and fought again to its north. The Qin troops suffered a great defeat.

sentences.zh: 或說沛公曰：「秦富十倍天下，地形彊。

translations.idiomatic: Someone advised Pei Gong: "Qin is ten times richer than the world, and its terrain is strong.
translations.text: Someone advised Pei Gong: "Qin is ten times richer than the world, and its terrain is strong.

sentences.zh: 今聞章邯降項羽，羽號曰雍王，王關中。

translations.idiomatic: Now we hear that Zhang Han has surrendered to Xiang Yu, who is titled King of Yong and rules Guanzhong.
translations.text: Now we hear that Zhang Han has surrendered to Xiang Yu, who is titled King of Yong and rules Guanzhong.

sentences.zh: 即來，沛公恐不得有 此。

translations.idiomatic: If he comes, Pei Gong fears he may not be able to hold this."
translations.text: If he comes, Pei Gong fears he may not be able to hold this."

sentences.zh: 可急使守函谷關，毋內諸侯軍，稍徵關中兵以自益，距之。」

translations.idiomatic: We can urgently send people to defend Hangu Pass and not let the feudal lords' armies enter, gradually conscript Guanzhong troops to strengthen ourselves, and resist them."
translations.text: We can urgently send people to defend Hangu Pass and not let the feudal lords' armies enter, gradually conscript Guanzhong troops to strengthen ourselves, and resist them."

sentences.zh: 沛公然其計，從之。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong approved this plan and followed it.
translations.text: Pei Gong approved this plan and followed it.

sentences.zh: 十二月，項羽果帥諸侯兵欲西入關，關門閉。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, Xiang Yu indeed led the feudal lords' troops wanting to enter the passes to the west, but the pass gates were closed.
translations.text: In the twelfth month, Xiang Yu indeed led the feudal lords' troops wanting to enter the passes to the west, but the pass gates were closed.

sentences.zh: 聞沛公已定關中，羽大怒，使黥 布等攻破函谷關，遂至戲下。

translations.idiomatic: He heard that Pei Gong had already pacified Guanzhong. Xiang Yu was greatly angered and sent Ying Bu and others to break through Hangu Pass, then reached Xixia.
translations.text: He heard that Pei Gong had already pacified Guanzhong. Xiang Yu was greatly angered and sent Ying Bu and others to break through Hangu Pass, then reached Xixia.

sentences.zh: 沛公左司馬曹毋傷聞羽怒，欲攻沛公，使人言羽曰：「沛公欲王關中，令子嬰相，珍寶盡有之。」

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong's left marshal Cao Wushang heard of Xiang Yu's anger and wanted to attack Pei Gong. He sent someone to tell Xiang Yu: "Pei Gong wants to become king of Guanzhong and has Zi Ying as chancellor, possessing all the precious treasures."
translations.text: Pei Gong's left marshal Cao Wushang heard of Xiang Yu's anger and wanted to attack Pei Gong. He sent someone to tell Xiang Yu: "Pei Gong wants to become king of Guanzhong and has Zi Ying as chancellor, possessing all the precious treasures."

sentences.zh: 欲以求封。

translations.idiomatic: He wanted to seek enfeoffment through this.
translations.text: He wanted to seek enfeoffment through this.

sentences.zh: 亞父范增說羽曰：「沛公 居山東時，貪財好色，今聞其入關，珍物無所取，婦女無所幸，此其志不小。

translations.idiomatic: Prime Minister Fan Zeng advised Xiang Yu: "When Pei Gong was in Shandong, he was greedy for wealth and fond of women. Now we hear that upon entering the passes, he has taken none of the precious objects and favored none of the women. His ambitions are not small.
translations.text: Prime Minister Fan Zeng advised Xiang Yu: "When Pei Gong was in Shandong, he was greedy for wealth and fond of women. Now we hear that upon entering the passes, he has taken none of the precious objects and favored none of the women. His ambitions are not small.

sentences.zh: 吾使人望其氣，皆為龍，成五色，此天子氣。

translations.idiomatic: I sent people to observe his aura, and it was all dragon-shaped, forming five colors. This is the aura of a Son of Heaven.
translations.text: I sent people to observe his aura, and it was all dragon-shaped, forming five colors. This is the aura of a Son of Heaven.

translations.idiomatic: Attack him urgently. Do not miss the opportunity."
translations.text: Attack him urgently. Do not miss the opportunity."

sentences.zh: 於是饗士，旦日合戰。

translations.idiomatic: So he feasted his troops and the next day engaged in battle.
translations.text: So he feasted his troops and the next day engaged in battle.

sentences.zh: 是時，羽兵四十萬，號百萬。

translations.idiomatic: At this time, Xiang Yu's troops numbered 400,000, claiming 1,000,000.
translations.text: At this time, Xiang Yu's troops numbered 400,000, claiming 1,000,000.

sentences.zh: 沛公兵十萬，號二十萬，力不敵。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong's troops numbered 100,000, claiming 200,000. Their strength was no match.
translations.text: Pei Gong's troops numbered 100,000, claiming 200,000. Their strength was no match.

sentences.zh: 會羽季父左尹項伯素善張良，夜馳見張良，具告其實，欲與俱去，毋特俱死。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu's uncle Xiang Bo had long been on good terms with Zhang Liang. He galloped at night to see Zhang Liang and told him everything in detail. He wanted to leave with him and not die together.
translations.text: Xiang Yu's uncle Xiang Bo had long been on good terms with Zhang Liang. He galloped at night to see Zhang Liang and told him everything in detail. He wanted to leave with him and not die together.

sentences.zh: 良曰：「臣為韓王送沛 公，不可不告，亡去不義。」

translations.idiomatic: Liang said: "I was sent by the King of Han to escort Pei Gong. I cannot fail to inform him. To flee would be unrighteous."
translations.text: Liang said: "I was sent by the King of Han to escort Pei Gong. I cannot fail to inform him. To flee would be unrighteous."

sentences.zh: 乃與項伯俱見沛公。

translations.idiomatic: So he went with Xiang Bo to see Pei Gong.
translations.text: So he went with Xiang Bo to see Pei Gong.

sentences.zh: 沛公與伯約為婚姻，曰：「吾入關，秋豪無所敢取，籍吏民，封府庫，待將軍。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong made a marriage alliance with Xiang Bo and said: "When I entered the passes, I dared not take even the smallest thing. I registered the officials and people, sealed the treasuries, and waited for the general.
translations.text: Pei Gong made a marriage alliance with Xiang Bo and said: "When I entered the passes, I dared not take even the smallest thing. I registered the officials and people, sealed the treasuries, and waited for the general.

sentences.zh: 所以守關者，備他盜也。

translations.idiomatic: The reason I guarded the passes was to prepare against other bandits.
translations.text: The reason I guarded the passes was to prepare against other bandits.

sentences.zh: 日夜望將 軍到，豈敢反邪！

translations.idiomatic: Day and night I hoped for the general's arrival. How could I dare rebel!
translations.text: Day and night I hoped for the general's arrival. How could I dare rebel!

sentences.zh: 願伯明言不敢背德。」

translations.idiomatic: I hope Xiang Bo will make this clear that I dare not betray righteousness."
translations.text: I hope Xiang Bo will make this clear that I dare not betray righteousness."

sentences.zh: 項伯許諾，即夜復去。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Bo agreed and that night left again.
translations.text: Xiang Bo agreed and that night left again.

sentences.zh: 戒沛公曰：「旦日不可不早自來謝。」

translations.idiomatic: He warned Pei Gong: "Tomorrow morning you must not fail to come early and apologize."
translations.text: He warned Pei Gong: "Tomorrow morning you must not fail to come early and apologize."

sentences.zh: 項伯還，具以沛公言告羽，因曰：「沛公不先破關中兵，公巨 能入乎？

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Bo returned and told Xiang Yu everything Pei Gong had said. He added: "If Pei Gong had not first broken the Guanzhong troops, could you have entered?
translations.text: Xiang Bo returned and told Xiang Yu everything Pei Gong had said. He added: "If Pei Gong had not first broken the Guanzhong troops, could you have entered?

sentences.zh: 且人有大功，擊之不祥，不如因善之。」

translations.idiomatic: Moreover, when someone has great merit, to attack him is inauspicious. It would be better to take advantage of and reward him."
translations.text: Moreover, when someone has great merit, to attack him is inauspicious. It would be better to take advantage of and reward him."

sentences.zh: 羽許諾。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu agreed.
translations.text: Xiang Yu agreed.

sentences.zh: 沛公旦日從百餘騎見羽鴻門，謝曰：「臣與將軍戮力攻秦，將軍戰河北，臣戰河南，不自意先入關，能破秦，與將軍復相見。

translations.idiomatic: The next morning Pei Gong came with over a hundred cavalry to see Xiang Yu at Hongmen. He apologized: "I and the general joined forces to attack Qin. The general fought north of the Yellow River, I fought south of the Yellow River. I did not expect to enter the passes first and break Qin, then meet the general again.
translations.text: The next morning Pei Gong came with over a hundred cavalry to see Xiang Yu at Hongmen. He apologized: "I and the general joined forces to attack Qin. The general fought north of the Yellow River, I fought south of the Yellow River. I did not expect to enter the passes first and break Qin, then meet the general again.

sentences.zh: 今者有小人言，令將軍與臣有隙。」

translations.idiomatic: Now some petty person has spoken, causing the general and me to have a rift."
translations.text: Now some petty person has spoken, causing the general and me to have a rift."

sentences.zh: 羽曰：「此沛公左司馬曹毋傷言之，不然，籍何以生此？」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said: "This was spoken by Pei Gong's left marshal Cao Wushang. Otherwise, how could I have thought this?"
translations.text: Xiang Yu said: "This was spoken by Pei Gong's left marshal Cao Wushang. Otherwise, how could I have thought this?"

sentences.zh: 羽因留沛公飲。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu then kept Pei Gong to drink.
translations.text: Xiang Yu then kept Pei Gong to drink.

sentences.zh: 范增數目羽擊沛公，羽不應。

translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng repeatedly signaled Xiang Yu to attack Pei Gong, but Xiang Yu did not respond.
translations.text: Fan Zeng repeatedly signaled Xiang Yu to attack Pei Gong, but Xiang Yu did not respond.

sentences.zh: 范增起，出謂項莊曰：「

translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng rose and went out to tell Xiang Zhuang:
translations.text: Fan Zeng rose and went out to tell Xiang Zhuang:

sentences.zh: 君王為人不忍，汝入以劍舞，因擊沛公，殺之。

translations.idiomatic: The lord is a man without mercy. You enter and perform the sword dance, then take advantage to strike Pei Gong and kill him.
translations.text: The lord is a man without mercy. You enter and perform the sword dance, then take advantage to strike Pei Gong and kill him.

sentences.zh: 不者，汝屬且為所虜。」

translations.idiomatic: If not, you and your clan will soon be his captives."
translations.text: If not, you and your clan will soon be his captives."

sentences.zh: 莊入為壽。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhuang entered and made a toast.
translations.text: Xiang Zhuang entered and made a toast.

sentences.zh: 壽畢，曰：「軍中無 以為樂，請以劍舞。」

translations.idiomatic: When the toast was finished, he said: "There is nothing to provide entertainment in the army. Please allow me to perform the sword dance."
translations.text: When the toast was finished, he said: "There is nothing to provide entertainment in the army. Please allow me to perform the sword dance."

sentences.zh: 因拔劍舞。

translations.idiomatic: So he drew his sword and began to dance.
translations.text: So he drew his sword and began to dance.

sentences.zh: 項伯亦起舞，常以身翼蔽沛公。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Bo also rose to dance, constantly using his body to shield Pei Gong.
translations.text: Xiang Bo also rose to dance, constantly using his body to shield Pei Gong.

sentences.zh: 樊噲聞事急，直入，怒甚。

translations.idiomatic: Fan Kuai heard the situation was urgent and charged straight in, extremely angry.
translations.text: Fan Kuai heard the situation was urgent and charged straight in, extremely angry.

sentences.zh: 羽壯之，賜以酒。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu admired his bravery and gave him wine.
translations.text: Xiang Yu admired his bravery and gave him wine.

sentences.zh: 噲因譙讓羽。

translations.idiomatic: Fan Kuai took advantage to rebuke Xiang Yu.
translations.text: Fan Kuai took advantage to rebuke Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 有頃，沛公起如廁，招樊噲出，置車官 屬，獨騎，與樊噲、靳彊、滕公、紀成步，從間道走軍，使張良留謝羽。

translations.idiomatic: After a while, Pei Gong rose as if to use the toilet and beckoned Fan Kuai to come out. He placed his chariot officials and retainers, rode alone with Fan Kuai, Jin Qiang, Lord Teng, and Ji Cheng on foot, escaping the army by a side road, leaving Zhang Liang to stay and apologize to Xiang Yu.
translations.text: After a while, Pei Gong rose as if to use the toilet and beckoned Fan Kuai to come out. He placed his chariot officials and retainers, rode alone with Fan Kuai, Jin Qiang, Lord Teng, and Ji Cheng on foot, escaping the army by a side road, leaving Zhang Liang to stay and apologize to Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 羽問：「沛公安在？」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu asked: "Where is Pei Gong?"
translations.text: Xiang Yu asked: "Where is Pei Gong?"

sentences.zh: 曰：「聞將軍有意督過之，脫身去，間至軍，故使臣獻璧。」

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang said: "He heard that the general intended to punish him for his faults. He slipped away and secretly returned to his army. Therefore he sent me to present this jade disk."
translations.text: Zhang Liang said: "He heard that the general intended to punish him for his faults. He slipped away and secretly returned to his army. Therefore he sent me to present this jade disk."

sentences.zh: 羽受 之。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu accepted it.
translations.text: Xiang Yu accepted it.

sentences.zh: 又獻玉斗范增。

translations.idiomatic: He also presented a jade goblet to Fan Zeng.
translations.text: He also presented a jade goblet to Fan Zeng.

sentences.zh: 增怒，撞其斗，起曰：「吾屬今為沛公虜矣！」

translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng was angry and smashed his goblet. He rose and said: "We and our clans will soon be Pei Gong's captives!"
translations.text: Fan Zeng was angry and smashed his goblet. He rose and said: "We and our clans will soon be Pei Gong's captives!"

sentences.zh: 沛公歸數日，羽引兵西屠咸陽，殺秦降王子嬰，燒秦宮室，所過無不殘滅。

translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong returned several days later. Xiang Yu led troops west to massacre Xianyang, killed the Qin surrender prince Zi Ying, burned the Qin palaces. Everywhere he passed, nothing was left undestroyed.
translations.text: Pei Gong returned several days later. Xiang Yu led troops west to massacre Xianyang, killed the Qin surrender prince Zi Ying, burned the Qin palaces. Everywhere he passed, nothing was left undestroyed.

sentences.zh: 秦民大失望。

translations.idiomatic: The Qin people were greatly disappointed.
translations.text: The Qin people were greatly disappointed.

sentences.zh: 羽使人還報懷王，懷王曰：「如約。」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu sent someone to report back to King Huai. King Huai said: "As agreed."
translations.text: Xiang Yu sent someone to report back to King Huai. King Huai said: "As agreed."

sentences.zh: 羽怨懷王不肯令與沛公俱西入關，而北救趙，後天下約。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu resented that King Huai had not allowed him to enter the passes together with Pei Gong, but instead had him go north to rescue Zhao, coming after the agreement about the world.
translations.text: Xiang Yu resented that King Huai had not allowed him to enter the passes together with Pei Gong, but instead had him go north to rescue Zhao, coming after the agreement about the world.

sentences.zh: 乃曰：「

translations.idiomatic: So he said:
translations.text: So he said:

sentences.zh: 懷王者，吾家所立耳，非有功伐，何以得專主約！

translations.idiomatic: King Huai was established by my family, he has no meritorious achievements. Why should he monopolize the agreements!
translations.text: King Huai was established by my family, he has no meritorious achievements. Why should he monopolize the agreements!

sentences.zh: 本定天下，諸將與籍也。」

translations.idiomatic: Originally it was the generals and I who pacified the world."
translations.text: Originally it was the generals and I who pacified the world."

sentences.zh: 春正月，陽尊懷王為義帝，實不用其命。

translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring, Yang honored King Huai as Righteous Emperor, but in reality did not follow his commands.
translations.text: In the first month of spring, Yang honored King Huai as Righteous Emperor, but in reality did not follow his commands.

sentences.zh: 二月，羽自立為西楚霸王，王梁、楚地九郡，都彭城。

translations.idiomatic: In the second month, Xiang Yu established himself as Hegemon King of Western Chu, ruling the lands of Liang and Chu, nine commanderies, with capital at Pengcheng.
translations.text: In the second month, Xiang Yu established himself as Hegemon King of Western Chu, ruling the lands of Liang and Chu, nine commanderies, with capital at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 背約，更立沛公為漢王，王巴、蜀、漢中四十一 縣，都南鄭。

translations.idiomatic: Breaking the agreement, he further established Pei Gong as King of Han, ruling Ba, Shu, Hanzhong, and 41 counties, with capital at Nanzheng.
translations.text: Breaking the agreement, he further established Pei Gong as King of Han, ruling Ba, Shu, Hanzhong, and 41 counties, with capital at Nanzheng.

sentences.zh: 三分關中，立秦三將：章邯為雍王，都廢丘；

translations.idiomatic: He divided Guanzhong into three parts, establishing the three Qin generals: Zhang Han as King of Yong, capital at Feiqiu;
translations.text: He divided Guanzhong into three parts, establishing the three Qin generals: Zhang Han as King of Yong, capital at Feiqiu;

sentences.zh: 司馬欣為塞王，都櫟陽；

translations.idiomatic: Sima Xin as King of Sai, capital at Queyang;
translations.text: Sima Xin as King of Sai, capital at Queyang;

sentences.zh: 董翳為翟王，都高奴。

translations.idiomatic: Dong Yi as King of Di, capital at Gaonu.
translations.text: Dong Yi as King of Di, capital at Gaonu.

sentences.zh: 楚將瑕丘申陽為河南王，都洛陽。

translations.idiomatic: Chu general Xiaqiu Shen Yang as King of Henan, capital at Luoyang.
translations.text: Chu general Xiaqiu Shen Yang as King of Henan, capital at Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 趙將司馬卬為殷王，都 朝歌。

translations.idiomatic: Zhao general Sima Ang as King of Yin, capital at Zhaoge.
translations.text: Zhao general Sima Ang as King of Yin, capital at Zhaoge.

sentences.zh: 當陽君英布為九江王，都六。

translations.idiomatic: Dangyang Lord Ying Bu as King of Jiujiang, capital at Liu.
translations.text: Dangyang Lord Ying Bu as King of Jiujiang, capital at Liu.

sentences.zh: 懷王柱國共敖為臨江王，都江陵。

translations.idiomatic: King Huai's Pillar of State Gong Ao as King of Linjiang, capital at Jiangling.
translations.text: King Huai's Pillar of State Gong Ao as King of Linjiang, capital at Jiangling.

sentences.zh: 番君吳芮為衡山王，都邾。

translations.idiomatic: Fan Jun Wu Rui as King of Hengshan, capital at Zhu.
translations.text: Fan Jun Wu Rui as King of Hengshan, capital at Zhu.

sentences.zh: 故齊王建孫田安為濟北王。

translations.idiomatic: The former King of Qi Jian's grandson Tian An as King of Jibei.
translations.text: The former King of Qi Jian's grandson Tian An as King of Jibei.

sentences.zh: 徙魏王豹為西魏王，都平陽。

translations.idiomatic: Moved King of Wei Bao to King of Western Wei, capital at Pingyang.
translations.text: Moved King of Wei Bao to King of Western Wei, capital at Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 徙燕王韓 廣為遼東王。

translations.idiomatic: Moved King of Yan Han Guang to King of Liaodong.
translations.text: Moved King of Yan Han Guang to King of Liaodong.

sentences.zh: 燕將臧荼為燕王，都薊。

translations.idiomatic: Yan general Zang Tu as King of Yan, capital at Ji.
translations.text: Yan general Zang Tu as King of Yan, capital at Ji.

sentences.zh: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。

translations.idiomatic: Moved King of Qi Tian Shi to King of Jiaodong.
translations.text: Moved King of Qi Tian Shi to King of Jiaodong.

sentences.zh: 齊將田都為齊王，都臨菑。

translations.idiomatic: Qi general Tian Du as King of Qi, capital at Linzi.
translations.text: Qi general Tian Du as King of Qi, capital at Linzi.

sentences.zh: 徙趙王歇為代王。

translations.idiomatic: Moved King of Zhao Xie to King of Dai.
translations.text: Moved King of Zhao Xie to King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 趙相張耳為常山王。

translations.idiomatic: Zhao chancellor Zhang Er as King of Changshan.
translations.text: Zhao chancellor Zhang Er as King of Changshan.

sentences.zh: 漢王怨羽之背約，欲攻之，丞相蕭何 諫，乃止。

translations.idiomatic: King Han resented Xiang Yu for breaking the agreement and wanted to attack him. Chancellor Xiao He advised against it, so he stopped.
translations.text: King Han resented Xiang Yu for breaking the agreement and wanted to attack him. Chancellor Xiao He advised against it, so he stopped.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。

translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, the feudal lords departed from Xixia and each went to their kingdoms.
translations.text: In the fourth month of summer, the feudal lords departed from Xixia and each went to their kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 羽使卒三萬人從漢王，楚子、諸侯人之慕從者數萬人，從杜南入蝕中。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu sent 30,000 troops to follow King Han, and Chu nobles and feudal lords who admired and followed him numbered several tens of thousands. They entered Shuzhong from Dushan.
translations.text: Xiang Yu sent 30,000 troops to follow King Han, and Chu nobles and feudal lords who admired and followed him numbered several tens of thousands. They entered Shuzhong from Dushan.

sentences.zh: 張良辭歸韓，漢王送至褒中，因說漢王燒絕棧道，以備諸侯盜兵，亦視項羽無東意。

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang took leave to return to Han. King Han escorted him to Baozhong, where Zhang Liang advised King Han to burn and destroy the plank roads to guard against bandit troops of the feudal lords, and also to show Xiang Yu that he had no intention of going east.
translations.text: Zhang Liang took leave to return to Han. King Han escorted him to Baozhong, where Zhang Liang advised King Han to burn and destroy the plank roads to guard against bandit troops of the feudal lords, and also to show Xiang Yu that he had no intention of going east.

sentences.zh: 漢王既至南鄭，諸將及士卒皆歌謳思東歸，多道亡還者。

translations.idiomatic: King Han having arrived at Nanzheng, the generals and soldiers all sang ballads longing to return east, and many deserted and went back by the roads.
translations.text: King Han having arrived at Nanzheng, the generals and soldiers all sang ballads longing to return east, and many deserted and went back by the roads.

sentences.zh: 韓信為治粟都尉，亦亡去，蕭何追還之，因薦於漢王，曰：「

translations.idiomatic: Han Xin was grain supply commander, but he also deserted. Xiao He pursued and brought him back, then recommended him to King Han, saying:
translations.text: Han Xin was grain supply commander, but he also deserted. Xiao He pursued and brought him back, then recommended him to King Han, saying:

sentences.zh: 必欲爭天下，非信無可與計事者。」

translations.idiomatic: If you truly wish to contend for the world, there is no one but Xin with whom you can plan affairs."
translations.text: If you truly wish to contend for the world, there is no one but Xin with whom you can plan affairs."

sentences.zh: 於是漢王齊戒設壇場，拜信為大將軍，問以計策。

translations.idiomatic: So King Han purified himself and set up an altar platform, appointing Xin as grand general and asking him for strategies.
translations.text: So King Han purified himself and set up an altar platform, appointing Xin as grand general and asking him for strategies.

sentences.zh: 信對曰：「項羽背 約而王君王於南鄭，是遷也。

translations.idiomatic: Xin replied: "Xiang Yu broke the agreement and enfeoffed you as king in Nanzheng. This was banishment.
translations.text: Xin replied: "Xiang Yu broke the agreement and enfeoffed you as king in Nanzheng. This was banishment.

sentences.zh: 吏卒皆山東之人，日夜企而望歸，及其鋒而用之，可以有大功。

translations.idiomatic: The officials and soldiers are all men from east of the mountains. Day and night they crane their necks longing to return home. If you take advantage of their keen edge and use them now, you can achieve great merit.
translations.text: The officials and soldiers are all men from east of the mountains. Day and night they crane their necks longing to return home. If you take advantage of their keen edge and use them now, you can achieve great merit.

sentences.zh: 天下已定，民皆自寧，不可復用。

translations.idiomatic: When the world is pacified, the people will all be at peace. They cannot be used again.
translations.text: When the world is pacified, the people will all be at peace. They cannot be used again.

sentences.zh: 不如決策東向。」

translations.idiomatic: It would be better to decide now and advance east."
translations.text: It would be better to decide now and advance east."

sentences.zh: 因陳羽可圖三秦易 并之計。

translations.idiomatic: He then laid out the plan for how Xiang Yu could be plotted against and the three Qins easily united.
translations.text: He then laid out the plan for how Xiang Yu could be plotted against and the three Qins easily united.

sentences.zh: 漢王大說，遂聽信策，部署諸將。

translations.idiomatic: King Han was greatly pleased and followed Xin's strategy, deploying the various generals.
translations.text: King Han was greatly pleased and followed Xin's strategy, deploying the various generals.

sentences.zh: 留蕭何收巴蜀租，給軍食。

translations.idiomatic: He left Xiao He to collect taxes from Ba and Shu to supply the army's provisions.
translations.text: He left Xiao He to collect taxes from Ba and Shu to supply the army's provisions.

sentences.zh: 五月，漢王引兵從故道出襲雍。

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, King Han led troops from the old road to attack Yong by surprise.
translations.text: In the fifth month, King Han led troops from the old road to attack Yong by surprise.

sentences.zh: 雍王邯迎擊漢陳倉，雍兵敗，還走；

translations.idiomatic: King Yong Zhang Han met and attacked the Han army at Chencang. The Yong troops were defeated and fled back;
translations.text: King Yong Zhang Han met and attacked the Han army at Chencang. The Yong troops were defeated and fled back;

sentences.zh: 戰好畤，又大敗，走廢丘。

translations.idiomatic: they fought at Haozhi and suffered another great defeat, fleeing to Feiqiu.
translations.text: they fought at Haozhi and suffered another great defeat, fleeing to Feiqiu.

sentences.zh: 漢王遂定雍地。

translations.idiomatic: King Han then pacified Yong territory.
translations.text: King Han then pacified Yong territory.

sentences.zh: 東如咸陽，引兵圍雍王廢丘，而遣諸將略地。

translations.idiomatic: He went east to Xianyang, led troops to surround King Yong at Feiqiu, and sent various generals to seize territory.
translations.text: He went east to Xianyang, led troops to surround King Yong at Feiqiu, and sent various generals to seize territory.

sentences.zh: 田榮聞羽徙齊王市於膠東而立田都為齊王，大怒，以齊兵迎擊田都。

translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong heard that Xiang Yu had moved King Qi Tian Shi to Jiaodong and established Tian Du as King of Qi. He was greatly angered and led Qi troops to attack Tian Du.
translations.text: Tian Rong heard that Xiang Yu had moved King Qi Tian Shi to Jiaodong and established Tian Du as King of Qi. He was greatly angered and led Qi troops to attack Tian Du.

sentences.zh: 都走降楚。

translations.idiomatic: Tian Du fled and surrendered to Chu.
translations.text: Tian Du fled and surrendered to Chu.

sentences.zh: 六月，田榮殺田市，自立 為齊王。

translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, Tian Rong killed Tian Shi and established himself as King of Qi.
translations.text: In the sixth month, Tian Rong killed Tian Shi and established himself as King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 時彭城在鉅野，眾萬餘人，無所屬。

translations.idiomatic: At this time Peng Yue was at Juye with over 10,000 followers, belonging to no one.
translations.text: At this time Peng Yue was at Juye with over 10,000 followers, belonging to no one.

sentences.zh: 榮與越將軍印，因令反梁地。

translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong gave the general's seal to the Yue general and ordered him to rebel in Liang territory.
translations.text: Tian Rong gave the general's seal to the Yue general and ordered him to rebel in Liang territory.

sentences.zh: 越擊殺濟北王安，榮遂并三齊之地。

translations.idiomatic: Yue attacked and killed King Jibei Tian An. Tian Rong then united the three Qi territories.
translations.text: Yue attacked and killed King Jibei Tian An. Tian Rong then united the three Qi territories.

sentences.zh: 燕王韓廣亦不肯徙遼東。

translations.idiomatic: King Yan Han Guang also refused to move to Liaodong.
translations.text: King Yan Han Guang also refused to move to Liaodong.

sentences.zh: 秋八月，臧荼殺韓廣，并其 地。

translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month of autumn, Zang Tu killed Han Guang and took his territory.
translations.text: In the eighth month of autumn, Zang Tu killed Han Guang and took his territory.

sentences.zh: 塞王欣、翟王翳皆降漢。

translations.idiomatic: King Sai Xin and King Di Yi both surrendered to Han.
translations.text: King Sai Xin and King Di Yi both surrendered to Han.

sentences.zh: 初，項梁立韓後公子成為韓王，張良為韓司徒。

translations.idiomatic: Initially, Xiang Liang established the Han royal descendant Cheng as King of Han, with Zhang Liang as Han tutor.
translations.text: Initially, Xiang Liang established the Han royal descendant Cheng as King of Han, with Zhang Liang as Han tutor.

sentences.zh: 羽以良從漢王，韓王成又無功，故不遣就國，與俱至彭 城，殺之。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu, because Liang followed King Han, and King Han Cheng had no merit, did not send him to his kingdom but brought him to Pengcheng and killed him.
translations.text: Xiang Yu, because Liang followed King Han, and King Han Cheng had no merit, did not send him to his kingdom but brought him to Pengcheng and killed him.

sentences.zh: 及聞漢王并關中，而齊、梁畔之，羽大怒，乃以故吳令鄭昌為韓王，距漢。

translations.idiomatic: When he heard that King Han had united Guanzhong and Qi and Liang had rebelled, Xiang Yu was greatly angered. He established the former Wu magistrate Zheng Chang as King of Han to oppose Han.
translations.text: When he heard that King Han had united Guanzhong and Qi and Liang had rebelled, Xiang Yu was greatly angered. He established the former Wu magistrate Zheng Chang as King of Han to oppose Han.

sentences.zh: 令蕭公角擊彭越，越敗角兵。

translations.idiomatic: He ordered Xiao Gong Jiao to attack Peng Yue. Yue defeated Jiao's troops.
translations.text: He ordered Xiao Gong Jiao to attack Peng Yue. Yue defeated Jiao's troops.

sentences.zh: 時張良徇韓地，遺羽書曰：「漢欲得關中，如約 即止，不敢復東。」

translations.idiomatic: At this time Zhang Liang was campaigning in Han territory. He sent Xiang Yu a letter: "Han wishes to obtain Guanzhong. If the agreement is honored, we will stop and dare not advance east again."
translations.text: At this time Zhang Liang was campaigning in Han territory. He sent Xiang Yu a letter: "Han wishes to obtain Guanzhong. If the agreement is honored, we will stop and dare not advance east again."

sentences.zh: 羽以故無西意，而北擊齊。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu therefore had no intention of going west, but instead attacked Qi to the north.
translations.text: Xiang Yu therefore had no intention of going west, but instead attacked Qi to the north.

sentences.zh: 九月，漢王遣將軍薛歐、王吸出武關，因王陵兵，從南陽迎太公、呂后於沛。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, King Han sent generals Xue Ou and Wang Xi out of Wuguan, relying on Wang Ling's troops, going from Nanyang to welcome the Duke of Tai and Empress Lü from Pei.
translations.text: In the ninth month, King Han sent generals Xue Ou and Wang Xi out of Wuguan, relying on Wang Ling's troops, going from Nanyang to welcome the Duke of Tai and Empress Lü from Pei.

sentences.zh: 羽聞之，發兵距之陽夏，不得前。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu heard of this and sent troops to block them at Yangxia, preventing them from advancing.
translations.text: Xiang Yu heard of this and sent troops to block them at Yangxia, preventing them from advancing.

sentences.zh: 二年冬十月，項羽使九江王布殺義帝於郴。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter in the second year, Xiang Yu ordered King Jiujiang Ying Bu to kill Righteous Emperor Huai at Chen.
translations.text: In the tenth month of winter in the second year, Xiang Yu ordered King Jiujiang Ying Bu to kill Righteous Emperor Huai at Chen.

sentences.zh: 陳餘亦怨羽獨不王己，從田榮藉助兵，以擊常山王張耳。

translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu also resented that Xiang Yu alone did not enfeoff him as king. He borrowed troops from Tian Rong and attacked King Changshan Zhang Er.
translations.text: Chen Yu also resented that Xiang Yu alone did not enfeoff him as king. He borrowed troops from Tian Rong and attacked King Changshan Zhang Er.

sentences.zh: 耳敗走降漢，漢王厚遇之。

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Er was defeated, fled, and surrendered to Han. King Han treated him generously.
translations.text: Zhang Er was defeated, fled, and surrendered to Han. King Han treated him generously.

sentences.zh: 陳餘迎代王歇還趙，歇立餘為代王。

translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu welcomed King Dai Xie back to Zhao. Xie established Yu as King of Dai.
translations.text: Chen Yu welcomed King Dai Xie back to Zhao. Xie established Yu as King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 張良自韓間行歸漢，漢王以為成信侯。

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang secretly made his way back to Han from Korea. King Han enfeoffed him as Lord Chengxin.
translations.text: Zhang Liang secretly made his way back to Han from Korea. King Han enfeoffed him as Lord Chengxin.

sentences.zh: 漢王如陝，鎮撫關外父老。

translations.idiomatic: King Han went to Shan and pacified the elders outside the passes.
translations.text: King Han went to Shan and pacified the elders outside the passes.

sentences.zh: 河南王申陽降，置河南郡。

translations.idiomatic: King Henan Shen Yang surrendered. Henan commandery was established.
translations.text: King Henan Shen Yang surrendered. Henan commandery was established.

sentences.zh: 使韓太尉韓信擊韓，韓王鄭昌降。

translations.idiomatic: He sent Han marshal Han Xin to attack Han. King Han Zheng Chang surrendered.
translations.text: He sent Han marshal Han Xin to attack Han. King Han Zheng Chang surrendered.

sentences.zh: 十一月，立韓太尉信為韓王。

translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, he established Han marshal Xin as King of Han.
translations.text: In the eleventh month, he established Han marshal Xin as King of Han.

sentences.zh: 漢王還歸，都櫟陽，使諸將略地，拔隴西。

translations.idiomatic: King Han returned and established his capital at Queyang, sending various generals to seize territory and capture Longxi.
translations.text: King Han returned and established his capital at Queyang, sending various generals to seize territory and capture Longxi.

sentences.zh: 以萬人若一郡降者，封萬戶。

translations.idiomatic: Those who surrendered with ten thousand men or an entire commandery were enfeoffed with ten thousand households.
translations.text: Those who surrendered with ten thousand men or an entire commandery were enfeoffed with ten thousand households.

sentences.zh: 繕治河上塞。

translations.idiomatic: He repaired the fortifications along the Yellow River.
translations.text: He repaired the fortifications along the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 故秦苑囿園池，令民得田之。

translations.idiomatic: The former Qin parks, gardens, and ponds were opened so the people could farm them.
translations.text: The former Qin parks, gardens, and ponds were opened so the people could farm them.

sentences.zh: 三月，漢王自臨晉渡河，魏王豹降，將兵從。

translations.idiomatic: In the third month, King Han crossed the Yellow River from Linjin. King Wei Bao surrendered and led troops to follow him.
translations.text: In the third month, King Han crossed the Yellow River from Linjin. King Wei Bao surrendered and led troops to follow him.

sentences.zh: 下河內，虜殷王卬，置河內郡。

translations.idiomatic: He took Henan and captured King Yin Ang, establishing Henan commandery.
translations.text: He took Henan and captured King Yin Ang, establishing Henan commandery.

sentences.zh: 至脩武，陳平亡楚來降。

translations.idiomatic: He reached Xiuwu. Chen Ping deserted Chu and came to surrender.
translations.text: He reached Xiuwu. Chen Ping deserted Chu and came to surrender.

sentences.zh: 漢 王與語，說之，使參乘，監諸將。

translations.idiomatic: King Han spoke with him and was pleased. He had him ride in the chariot and oversee the various generals.
translations.text: King Han spoke with him and was pleased. He had him ride in the chariot and oversee the various generals.

sentences.zh: 南渡平陰津，至洛陽，新城三老董公遮說漢王曰：「臣聞『順德者昌，逆德者亡』，『兵出無名，事故不成』。

translations.idiomatic: He crossed south at Pingyin ford and reached Luoyang. The elder of Xincheng, Dong Gong, blocked and advised King Han: "I have heard that 'those who follow virtue prosper, those who oppose virtue perish,' and 'when troops are sent out without just cause, affairs will not succeed."
translations.text: He crossed south at Pingyin ford and reached Luoyang. The elder of Xincheng, Dong Gong, blocked and advised King Han: "I have heard that 'those who follow virtue prosper, those who oppose virtue perish,' and 'when troops are sent out without just cause, affairs will not succeed."

sentences.zh: 故曰：『明其為 賊，敵乃可服。』

translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: 'Make clear that he is the traitor, and the enemy can then be subdued."
translations.text: Therefore it is said: 'Make clear that he is the traitor, and the enemy can then be subdued."

sentences.zh: 項羽為無道，放殺其主，天下之賊也。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu acts without righteousness, having deposed and killed his lord. He is the traitor of the world.
translations.text: Xiang Yu acts without righteousness, having deposed and killed his lord. He is the traitor of the world.

sentences.zh: 夫仁不以勇，義不以力，三軍之眾為之素服，以告之諸侯，為此東伐，四海之內莫不仰德。

translations.idiomatic: Benevolence does not rely on bravery, righteousness does not rely on strength. The multitudes of the three armies will sincerely submit to you. Proclaim this to the feudal lords and then advance east. All within the four seas will look up to your virtue.
translations.text: Benevolence does not rely on bravery, righteousness does not rely on strength. The multitudes of the three armies will sincerely submit to you. Proclaim this to the feudal lords and then advance east. All within the four seas will look up to your virtue.

sentences.zh: 此三王之舉 也。」

translations.idiomatic: This is the undertaking of the Three Kings."
translations.text: This is the undertaking of the Three Kings."

sentences.zh: 漢王曰：「善，非夫子無所聞。」
