translations.idiomatic: King Han said: "Excellent. Were it not for you, sir, I would have heard nothing of this."
translations.text: King Han said: "Excellent. Were it not for you, sir, I would have heard nothing of this."

sentences.zh: 於是漢王為義帝發喪，袒而大哭，哀臨三日。

translations.idiomatic: So King Han held mourning rites for the Righteous Emperor, bared his shoulder and wept loudly, conducting the mourning rites for three days.
translations.text: So King Han held mourning rites for the Righteous Emperor, bared his shoulder and wept loudly, conducting the mourning rites for three days.

sentences.zh: 發使告諸侯曰：「

translations.idiomatic: He sent envoys to proclaim to the feudal lords:
translations.text: He sent envoys to proclaim to the feudal lords:

sentences.zh: 天下共立義帝，北面事之。

translations.idiomatic: The world together established the Righteous Emperor and served him facing north.
translations.text: The world together established the Righteous Emperor and served him facing north.

sentences.zh: 今項羽放殺義帝江南，大逆無道。

translations.idiomatic: Now Xiang Yu has deposed and killed the Righteous Emperor in Jiangnan. This is great rebellion without righteousness.
translations.text: Now Xiang Yu has deposed and killed the Righteous Emperor in Jiangnan. This is great rebellion without righteousness.

sentences.zh: 寡人親為發喪，兵皆縞素。

translations.idiomatic: I personally conduct the mourning rites. All troops wear white mourning clothes.
translations.text: I personally conduct the mourning rites. All troops wear white mourning clothes.

sentences.zh: 悉發關中兵，收三河士，南浮江漢以下，願從諸侯王擊楚之殺義帝者。」

translations.idiomatic: Mobilize all Guanzhong troops, gather the warriors of the three river regions, float south on the Jiang and Han rivers and below, and wish to follow the feudal lords to attack those who killed the Righteous Emperor in Chu."
translations.text: Mobilize all Guanzhong troops, gather the warriors of the three river regions, float south on the Jiang and Han rivers and below, and wish to follow the feudal lords to attack those who killed the Righteous Emperor in Chu."

sentences.zh: 夏四月，田榮弟橫收得數萬人，立榮子廣為齊王。

translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, Tian Rong's younger brother Heng gathered several tens of thousands of men and established Tian Rong's son Guang as King of Qi.
translations.text: In the fourth month of summer, Tian Rong's younger brother Heng gathered several tens of thousands of men and established Tian Rong's son Guang as King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 羽雖聞漢東，既擊齊，欲遂破之而後擊漢，漢王以故得 劫五諸侯兵，東伐楚。

translations.idiomatic: Although Xiang Yu heard that Han was advancing east, since he was attacking Qi, he wished to completely defeat Qi first and then attack Han. King Han therefore was able to coerce the five feudal lords' troops and advance east to attack Chu.
translations.text: Although Xiang Yu heard that Han was advancing east, since he was attacking Qi, he wished to completely defeat Qi first and then attack Han. King Han therefore was able to coerce the five feudal lords' troops and advance east to attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 到外黃，彭越將三萬人歸漢。

translations.idiomatic: He reached Waihuang. Peng Yue led 30,000 men and surrendered to Han.
translations.text: He reached Waihuang. Peng Yue led 30,000 men and surrendered to Han.

sentences.zh: 漢王拜越為魏相國，令定梁地。

translations.idiomatic: King Han appointed Yue as prime minister of Wei and ordered him to pacify Liang territory.
translations.text: King Han appointed Yue as prime minister of Wei and ordered him to pacify Liang territory.

sentences.zh: 漢王遂入彭城，收羽美人貨賂，置酒高會。

translations.idiomatic: King Han then entered Pengcheng, took Xiang Yu's beautiful women and treasures, and held a great banquet.
translations.text: King Han then entered Pengcheng, took Xiang Yu's beautiful women and treasures, and held a great banquet.

sentences.zh: 羽聞之，令其將擊齊，而自以精兵三 萬人從魯出胡陵，至蕭，晨擊漢軍，大戰彭城靈壁東睢水上，大破漢軍，多殺士卒，睢水為之不流。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu heard of this and ordered his generals to attack Qi, while he himself led 30,000 elite troops from Lu through Huling to Xiao. At dawn he attacked the Han army, fighting a great battle east of Pengcheng at Lingbi on the Sui River. He greatly defeated the Han army, killing many soldiers and officers. The Sui River stopped flowing because of the bodies.
translations.text: Xiang Yu heard of this and ordered his generals to attack Qi, while he himself led 30,000 elite troops from Lu through Huling to Xiao. At dawn he attacked the Han army, fighting a great battle east of Pengcheng at Lingbi on the Sui River. He greatly defeated the Han army, killing many soldiers and officers. The Sui River stopped flowing because of the bodies.

sentences.zh: 圍漢王三匝。

translations.idiomatic: He surrounded King Han three times.
translations.text: He surrounded King Han three times.

sentences.zh: 大風從西北起，折木發屋，揚砂石，晝晦，楚軍大 亂，而漢王得與數十騎遁去。

translations.idiomatic: A great wind arose from the northwest, breaking trees and tearing off roofs, whipping up sand and stones, darkening the day. The Chu army was greatly thrown into confusion, and King Han was able to escape with several dozen cavalry.
translations.text: A great wind arose from the northwest, breaking trees and tearing off roofs, whipping up sand and stones, darkening the day. The Chu army was greatly thrown into confusion, and King Han was able to escape with several dozen cavalry.

sentences.zh: 過沛，使人求室家，室家亦已亡，不相得。

translations.idiomatic: Passing through Pei, he sent people to seek his family. His family had also fled and they could not find each other.
translations.text: Passing through Pei, he sent people to seek his family. His family had also fled and they could not find each other.

sentences.zh: 漢王道逢孝惠、魯元，載行。

translations.idiomatic: King Han met Xiaohui and Lu Yuan on the road and had them ride in the carriage.
translations.text: King Han met Xiaohui and Lu Yuan on the road and had them ride in the carriage.

sentences.zh: 楚騎追漢王，漢王急，推墮二子。

translations.idiomatic: Chu cavalry pursued King Han. King Han was desperate and pushed the two children off the carriage.
translations.text: Chu cavalry pursued King Han. King Han was desperate and pushed the two children off the carriage.

sentences.zh: 滕公下收載，遂得脫。

translations.idiomatic: Lord Teng dismounted to pick them up and put them in the carriage, and thus they escaped.
translations.text: Lord Teng dismounted to pick them up and put them in the carriage, and thus they escaped.

sentences.zh: 審食 其從太公、呂后間行，反遇楚軍，羽常置軍中以為質。

translations.idiomatic: Shen Yiji secretly escorted the Duke of Tai and Empress Lü, but encountered Chu troops. Xiang Yu constantly kept them in the army as hostages.
translations.text: Shen Yiji secretly escorted the Duke of Tai and Empress Lü, but encountered Chu troops. Xiang Yu constantly kept them in the army as hostages.

sentences.zh: 諸侯見漢敗，皆亡去。

translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords saw that Han was defeated and all fled.
translations.text: The feudal lords saw that Han was defeated and all fled.

sentences.zh: 塞王欣、翟王翳降楚，殷王卬死。

translations.idiomatic: King Sai Xin and King Di Yi surrendered to Chu. King Yin Ang died.
translations.text: King Sai Xin and King Di Yi surrendered to Chu. King Yin Ang died.

sentences.zh: 呂后兄周呂侯將兵居下邑，漢王往從之。

translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü's elder brother Zhou Lühou led troops stationed at Xiayi. King Han went to join him.
translations.text: Empress Lü's elder brother Zhou Lühou led troops stationed at Xiayi. King Han went to join him.

sentences.zh: 稍收士卒，軍碭。

translations.idiomatic: He gradually gathered soldiers and officers, encamping at Dang.
translations.text: He gradually gathered soldiers and officers, encamping at Dang.

sentences.zh: 漢王西過梁地，至虞，謂謁者隨何曰：「公能說九江王布使舉兵畔楚，項王必留擊之。

translations.idiomatic: King Han passed west through Liang territory and reached Yu. He said to the usher Sui He: "You can persuade King Jiujiang Ying Bu to raise troops and rebel against Chu. Xiang Yu will certainly stay to attack him.
translations.text: King Han passed west through Liang territory and reached Yu. He said to the usher Sui He: "You can persuade King Jiujiang Ying Bu to raise troops and rebel against Chu. Xiang Yu will certainly stay to attack him.

sentences.zh: 得留數月，吾取天下必矣。」

translations.idiomatic: If we can hold him back for several months, I will certainly take the world."
translations.text: If we can hold him back for several months, I will certainly take the world."

sentences.zh: 隨何往說布，果使畔楚。

translations.idiomatic: Sui He went to persuade Ying Bu, and indeed made him rebel against Chu.
translations.text: Sui He went to persuade Ying Bu, and indeed made him rebel against Chu.

sentences.zh: 五月，漢王屯滎陽，蕭何發關中老弱未傅者悉詣軍。

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, King Han encamped at Xingyang. Xiao He conscripted all the old and weak in Guanzhong who had not yet been registered and sent them all to the army.
translations.text: In the fifth month, King Han encamped at Xingyang. Xiao He conscripted all the old and weak in Guanzhong who had not yet been registered and sent them all to the army.

sentences.zh: 韓信亦收兵與漢王會，兵復大振。

translations.idiomatic: Han Xin also gathered troops and joined King Han. The army was greatly strengthened again.
translations.text: Han Xin also gathered troops and joined King Han. The army was greatly strengthened again.

sentences.zh: 與楚戰滎陽南京、索間，破之。

translations.idiomatic: They fought Chu at Xingyang south of Nanjing and between the Suo River, defeating them.
translations.text: They fought Chu at Xingyang south of Nanjing and between the Suo River, defeating them.

sentences.zh: 築甬道，屬河，以取敖倉粟。

translations.idiomatic: They built a covered walkway connecting to the Yellow River to obtain grain from Aocang.
translations.text: They built a covered walkway connecting to the Yellow River to obtain grain from Aocang.

sentences.zh: 魏王豹謁歸視親疾。

translations.idiomatic: King Wei Bao took leave to return and visit his ailing parent.
translations.text: King Wei Bao took leave to return and visit his ailing parent.

sentences.zh: 至則絕河津，反為楚。

translations.idiomatic: Upon arriving, he cut off the river crossings and rebelled for Chu.
translations.text: Upon arriving, he cut off the river crossings and rebelled for Chu.

sentences.zh: 六月，漢王還櫟陽。

translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, King Han returned to Queyang.
translations.text: In the sixth month, King Han returned to Queyang.

sentences.zh: 壬午，立太子，赦罪人。

translations.idiomatic: On the day renwu, he established the crown prince and pardoned criminals.
translations.text: On the day renwu, he established the crown prince and pardoned criminals.

sentences.zh: 令諸侯子在關中者皆集櫟陽為衛。

translations.idiomatic: He ordered all the feudal lords' sons in Guanzhong to assemble at Queyang as guards.
translations.text: He ordered all the feudal lords' sons in Guanzhong to assemble at Queyang as guards.

sentences.zh: 引水灌廢丘，廢丘降，章邯自殺。

translations.idiomatic: He diverted water to flood Feiqiu. Feiqiu surrendered. Zhang Han committed suicide.
translations.text: He diverted water to flood Feiqiu. Feiqiu surrendered. Zhang Han committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 雍州定，八十餘縣，置河上、渭南、中地、隴西、上郡。

translations.idiomatic: Yong province was pacified with over 80 counties. He established Heshang, Weinan, Zhongdi, Longxi, and Shangjun commanderies.
translations.text: Yong province was pacified with over 80 counties. He established Heshang, Weinan, Zhongdi, Longxi, and Shangjun commanderies.

sentences.zh: 令祠官祀天地四方上帝山川，以時祠之。

translations.idiomatic: He ordered the ritual officials to sacrifice to Heaven, Earth, the Four Directions, Supreme Deities, mountains, and rivers, making sacrifices at the proper times.
translations.text: He ordered the ritual officials to sacrifice to Heaven, Earth, the Four Directions, Supreme Deities, mountains, and rivers, making sacrifices at the proper times.

sentences.zh: 興關中卒乘邊塞。

translations.idiomatic: He raised Guanzhong troops to garrison the border fortifications.
translations.text: He raised Guanzhong troops to garrison the border fortifications.

sentences.zh: 關中大飢，米斛萬錢，人相食。

translations.idiomatic: Guanzhong suffered great famine. Rice cost 10,000 cash per bushel. People ate each other.
translations.text: Guanzhong suffered great famine. Rice cost 10,000 cash per bushel. People ate each other.

sentences.zh: 令民就食蜀漢。

translations.idiomatic: He ordered the people to go to Shu and Han for food.
translations.text: He ordered the people to go to Shu and Han for food.

sentences.zh: 秋八月，漢王如滎陽，謂酈食其曰：「緩頰往說魏王豹，能下之，以魏地萬戶封生。」

translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month of autumn, King Han went to Xingyang and said to Li Yiji: "Go slowly to persuade King Wei Bao. If you can make him submit, I will enfeoff you with 10,000 households from Wei territory."
translations.text: In the eighth month of autumn, King Han went to Xingyang and said to Li Yiji: "Go slowly to persuade King Wei Bao. If you can make him submit, I will enfeoff you with 10,000 households from Wei territory."

sentences.zh: 食其往，豹不聽。

translations.idiomatic: Li Yiji went, but Bao did not listen.
translations.text: Li Yiji went, but Bao did not listen.

sentences.zh: 漢王以韓信為左丞相，與曹參、灌嬰俱擊魏。

translations.idiomatic: King Han appointed Han Xin as left chancellor, and together with Cao Can and Guan Ying attacked Wei.
translations.text: King Han appointed Han Xin as left chancellor, and together with Cao Can and Guan Ying attacked Wei.

sentences.zh: 食其還，漢王問：「魏大將誰也？」

translations.idiomatic: Li Yiji returned. King Han asked: "Who is Wei's chief general?"
translations.text: Li Yiji returned. King Han asked: "Who is Wei's chief general?"

sentences.zh: 對曰：「柏直。」

translations.idiomatic: He replied: "Bai Zhi."
translations.text: He replied: "Bai Zhi."

sentences.zh: 王曰：「是口尚乳臭，不能當韓信。

translations.idiomatic: The king said: "His mouth still smells of milk. He cannot face Han Xin.
translations.text: The king said: "His mouth still smells of milk. He cannot face Han Xin.

sentences.zh: 騎將誰也？」

translations.idiomatic: Who is their cavalry general?"
translations.text: Who is their cavalry general?"

sentences.zh: 曰：「馮 敬。」

translations.idiomatic: He said: "Feng Jing."
translations.text: He said: "Feng Jing."

sentences.zh: 曰：「是秦將馮無擇子也，雖賢，不能當灌嬰。

translations.idiomatic: He said: "He is the son of the Qin general Feng Wuzhe. Though capable, he cannot face Guan Ying.
translations.text: He said: "He is the son of the Qin general Feng Wuzhe. Though capable, he cannot face Guan Ying.

sentences.zh: 步卒將誰也？」

translations.idiomatic: Who is their infantry general?"
translations.text: Who is their infantry general?"

sentences.zh: 曰：「項它。」

translations.idiomatic: He said: "Xiang Tuo."
translations.text: He said: "Xiang Tuo."

sentences.zh: 曰：「是不能當曹參。

translations.idiomatic: He said: "He cannot face Cao Can.
translations.text: He said: "He cannot face Cao Can.

sentences.zh: 吾無患矣。」

translations.idiomatic: I have no worries."
translations.text: I have no worries."

sentences.zh: 九月，信等虜豹，傳詣滎陽。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, Xin and others captured Bao and sent him to Xingyang.
translations.text: In the ninth month, Xin and others captured Bao and sent him to Xingyang.

sentences.zh: 定魏地，置 河東、太原、上黨郡。

translations.idiomatic: They pacified Wei territory and established Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang commanderies.
translations.text: They pacified Wei territory and established Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang commanderies.

sentences.zh: 信使人請兵三萬人，願以北舉燕趙，東擊齊，南絕楚糧道。

translations.idiomatic: Xin sent someone to request 30,000 troops, wishing to advance north against Yan and Zhao, east against Qi, and south to cut off Chu's grain routes.
translations.text: Xin sent someone to request 30,000 troops, wishing to advance north against Yan and Zhao, east against Qi, and south to cut off Chu's grain routes.

sentences.zh: 漢王與之。

translations.idiomatic: King Han agreed.
translations.text: King Han agreed.

sentences.zh: 三年冬十月，韓信、張耳東下井陘擊趙，斬陳餘，獲趙王歇。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter in the third year, Han Xin and Zhang Er advanced east through Jingxing to attack Zhao, executed Chen Yu, and captured King Zhao Xie.
translations.text: In the tenth month of winter in the third year, Han Xin and Zhang Er advanced east through Jingxing to attack Zhao, executed Chen Yu, and captured King Zhao Xie.

sentences.zh: 置常山、代郡。

translations.idiomatic: They established Changshan and Dai commanderies.
translations.text: They established Changshan and Dai commanderies.

sentences.zh: 甲戌晦，日有食之。

translations.idiomatic: On the day jiachen last day of the month, there was a solar eclipse.
translations.text: On the day jiachen last day of the month, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 十一月癸卯晦，日有食之。

translations.idiomatic: On the day guimao last day of the eleventh month, there was a solar eclipse.
translations.text: On the day guimao last day of the eleventh month, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 隨何既說黥布，布起兵攻楚。

translations.idiomatic: After Sui He persuaded Ying Bu, Bu raised troops to attack Chu.
translations.text: After Sui He persuaded Ying Bu, Bu raised troops to attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚使項聲、龍且攻布，布戰不勝。

translations.idiomatic: Chu sent Xiang Sheng and Long Ju to attack Bu. Bu fought but was not victorious.
translations.text: Chu sent Xiang Sheng and Long Ju to attack Bu. Bu fought but was not victorious.

sentences.zh: 十二月，布與隨何間行歸漢。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, Bu and Sui He secretly made their way back to Han.
translations.text: In the twelfth month, Bu and Sui He secretly made their way back to Han.

sentences.zh: 漢王分之兵，與俱收兵至成皋。

translations.idiomatic: King Han divided his troops with them and together gathered troops to reach Chenggao.
translations.text: King Han divided his troops with them and together gathered troops to reach Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 項羽數侵奪漢甬道，漢軍乏食，與酈食其謀橈楚權。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu repeatedly invaded and seized Han's covered walkway. The Han army lacked food. He consulted with Li Yiji about weakening Chu's power.
translations.text: Xiang Yu repeatedly invaded and seized Han's covered walkway. The Han army lacked food. He consulted with Li Yiji about weakening Chu's power.

sentences.zh: 食其欲立六國後以樹黨，漢王刻印，將遣食其立之。

translations.idiomatic: Li Yiji wished to establish the descendants of the six kingdoms to create allies. King Han carved seals and was about to send Li Yiji to establish them.
translations.text: Li Yiji wished to establish the descendants of the six kingdoms to create allies. King Han carved seals and was about to send Li Yiji to establish them.

sentences.zh: 以問張良，良發八難。

translations.idiomatic: He asked Zhang Liang about it. Liang presented eight difficulties.
translations.text: He asked Zhang Liang about it. Liang presented eight difficulties.

sentences.zh: 漢王輟飯吐哺，曰：「豎儒幾敗乃公事！」

translations.idiomatic: King Han put down his food and spat it out, saying: "This pedantic scholar almost ruined your lord's affairs!"
translations.text: King Han put down his food and spat it out, saying: "This pedantic scholar almost ruined your lord's affairs!"

sentences.zh: 令趨銷印。

translations.idiomatic: He ordered them to hurry and destroy the seals.
translations.text: He ordered them to hurry and destroy the seals.

sentences.zh: 又問陳平，乃從其計，與平黃金四萬斤，以間疏楚君臣。

translations.idiomatic: He also asked Chen Ping, then followed his plan, giving Ping 40,000 jin of gold to sow dissension and alienate Chu's ruler and ministers.
translations.text: He also asked Chen Ping, then followed his plan, giving Ping 40,000 jin of gold to sow dissension and alienate Chu's ruler and ministers.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，項羽圍漢滎陽，漢王請和，割滎陽以西者為漢。

translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, Xiang Yu surrounded Han at Xingyang. King Han requested peace, offering to divide Xingyang west as Han territory.
translations.text: In the fourth month of summer, Xiang Yu surrounded Han at Xingyang. King Han requested peace, offering to divide Xingyang west as Han territory.

sentences.zh: 亞父勸項羽急攻滎陽，漢王患之。

translations.idiomatic: Prime Minister Fan advised Xiang Yu to urgently attack Xingyang. King Han was troubled by this.
translations.text: Prime Minister Fan advised Xiang Yu to urgently attack Xingyang. King Han was troubled by this.

sentences.zh: 陳平反間既行，羽果疑亞父。

translations.idiomatic: Chen Ping's reverse espionage having succeeded, Xiang Yu indeed suspected Prime Minister Fan.
translations.text: Chen Ping's reverse espionage having succeeded, Xiang Yu indeed suspected Prime Minister Fan.

sentences.zh: 亞父大怒而去，發病死。

translations.idiomatic: Prime Minister Fan was greatly angered and left. He fell ill and died.
translations.text: Prime Minister Fan was greatly angered and left. He fell ill and died.

sentences.zh: 五月，將軍紀信曰：「事急矣！

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, General Ji Xin said: "The situation is urgent!
translations.text: In the fifth month, General Ji Xin said: "The situation is urgent!

sentences.zh: 臣請誑楚，可以間出。」

translations.idiomatic: I request to deceive Chu so we can break out."
translations.text: I request to deceive Chu so we can break out."

sentences.zh: 於是陳平夜出女子東門二千餘人，楚因四面擊 之。

translations.idiomatic: So Chen Ping at night sent out over 2,000 women through the east gate. Chu then attacked from all four sides.
translations.text: So Chen Ping at night sent out over 2,000 women through the east gate. Chu then attacked from all four sides.

sentences.zh: 紀信乃乘王車，黃屋左纛，曰：「食盡，漢王降楚。」

translations.idiomatic: Ji Xin then rode in the king's chariot with yellow canopy and left banner, saying: "Food is exhausted. King Han surrenders to Chu."
translations.text: Ji Xin then rode in the king's chariot with yellow canopy and left banner, saying: "Food is exhausted. King Han surrenders to Chu."

sentences.zh: 楚皆呼萬歲，之城東觀，以故漢王得與數十騎出西門遁。

translations.idiomatic: All the Chu troops shouted ten thousand years. They went to the east wall to watch, so King Han was able to escape with several dozen cavalry through the west gate.
translations.text: All the Chu troops shouted ten thousand years. They went to the east wall to watch, so King Han was able to escape with several dozen cavalry through the west gate.

sentences.zh: 令御史大夫周苛、魏豹、樅公守滎陽。

translations.idiomatic: He ordered Imperial Secretary Zhou Ke, Wei Bao, and Lord Song to defend Xingyang.
translations.text: He ordered Imperial Secretary Zhou Ke, Wei Bao, and Lord Song to defend Xingyang.

sentences.zh: 羽見紀 信，問：「漢王安在？」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu saw Ji Xin and asked: "Where is King Han?"
translations.text: Xiang Yu saw Ji Xin and asked: "Where is King Han?"

sentences.zh: 曰：「已出去矣。」

translations.idiomatic: He said: "He has already left."
translations.text: He said: "He has already left."

sentences.zh: 羽燒殺信。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu burned and killed Xin.
translations.text: Xiang Yu burned and killed Xin.

sentences.zh: 而周苛、樅公相謂曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」

translations.idiomatic: Zhou Ke and Lord Song said to each other: "The king of a rebellious kingdom is difficult to defend the city with."
translations.text: Zhou Ke and Lord Song said to each other: "The king of a rebellious kingdom is difficult to defend the city with."

sentences.zh: 因殺魏豹。

translations.idiomatic: So they killed Wei Bao.
translations.text: So they killed Wei Bao.

sentences.zh: 漢王出滎陽，至成皋。

translations.idiomatic: King Han left Xingyang and reached Chenggao.
translations.text: King Han left Xingyang and reached Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 自成皋入關，收兵欲復東。

translations.idiomatic: From Chenggao he entered the passes, gathered troops, and wanted to advance east again.
translations.text: From Chenggao he entered the passes, gathered troops, and wanted to advance east again.

sentences.zh: 轅生說漢王曰：「漢與楚相距滎陽數歲，漢常困。

translations.idiomatic: Guan Sheng advised King Han: "Han and Chu have confronted each other at Xingyang for several years. Han has often been in difficulty.
translations.text: Guan Sheng advised King Han: "Han and Chu have confronted each other at Xingyang for several years. Han has often been in difficulty.

sentences.zh: 願君 王出武關，項王必引兵南走，王深壁，令滎陽成皋間且得休息。

translations.idiomatic: I hope your majesty will go out through Wuguan. Xiang Yu will certainly lead troops south. Your majesty should fortify deeply and let the area between Xingyang and Chenggao get some rest.
translations.text: I hope your majesty will go out through Wuguan. Xiang Yu will certainly lead troops south. Your majesty should fortify deeply and let the area between Xingyang and Chenggao get some rest.

sentences.zh: 使韓信等得輯河北趙地，連燕齊，君王乃復走滎陽。

translations.idiomatic: Let Han Xin and others consolidate the lands north of the Yellow River in Zhao, connecting Yan and Qi. Your majesty can then return to Xingyang.
translations.text: Let Han Xin and others consolidate the lands north of the Yellow River in Zhao, connecting Yan and Qi. Your majesty can then return to Xingyang.

sentences.zh: 如此，則楚所備者多，力分。

translations.idiomatic: In this way, Chu will have many places to defend, and their strength will be divided.
translations.text: In this way, Chu will have many places to defend, and their strength will be divided.

sentences.zh: 漢得休息，復與之 戰，破之必矣。」

translations.idiomatic: Han will get rest, then fight them again. Defeating them will certainly be possible."
translations.text: Han will get rest, then fight them again. Defeating them will certainly be possible."

sentences.zh: 漢王從其計，出軍宛葉間，與黥布行收兵。

translations.idiomatic: King Han followed his plan, led troops out between Wan and Ye, and together with Ying Bu went to gather troops.
translations.text: King Han followed his plan, led troops out between Wan and Ye, and together with Ying Bu went to gather troops.

sentences.zh: 羽聞漢王在宛，果引兵南，漢王堅壁不與戰。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu heard that King Han was at Wan and indeed led troops south. King Han fortified deeply and did not fight him.
translations.text: Xiang Yu heard that King Han was at Wan and indeed led troops south. King Han fortified deeply and did not fight him.

sentences.zh: 是月，彭越渡睢，與項聲、薛公戰下邳，破殺薛公。

translations.idiomatic: In this month, Peng Yue crossed the Sui River and fought Xiang Sheng and Xue Gong at Xiapi, defeating and killing Xue Gong.
translations.text: In this month, Peng Yue crossed the Sui River and fought Xiang Sheng and Xue Gong at Xiapi, defeating and killing Xue Gong.

sentences.zh: 羽使終 公守成皋，而自東擊彭越。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu had Zhong Gong defend Chenggao while he himself went east to attack Peng Yue.
translations.text: Xiang Yu had Zhong Gong defend Chenggao while he himself went east to attack Peng Yue.

sentences.zh: 漢王引兵北，擊破終公，復軍成皋。

translations.idiomatic: King Han led troops north, attacked and defeated Zhong Gong, and returned his army to Chenggao.
translations.text: King Han led troops north, attacked and defeated Zhong Gong, and returned his army to Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 六月，羽已破走彭越，聞漢復軍成皋，乃引兵西拔滎陽城，生得周苛。

translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, Xiang Yu had already defeated and routed Peng Yue. He heard that Han had returned his army to Chenggao, so he led troops west and captured Xingyang city, taking Zhou Ke alive.
translations.text: In the sixth month, Xiang Yu had already defeated and routed Peng Yue. He heard that Han had returned his army to Chenggao, so he led troops west and captured Xingyang city, taking Zhou Ke alive.

sentences.zh: 羽謂苛：「為我將，以公為上 將軍，封三萬戶。」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said to Ke: "Be my general. I will make you supreme general and enfeoff you with 30,000 households."
translations.text: Xiang Yu said to Ke: "Be my general. I will make you supreme general and enfeoff you with 30,000 households."

sentences.zh: 周苛罵曰：「若不趨降漢，今為虜矣！

translations.idiomatic: Zhou Ke cursed: "If you do not quickly surrender to Han, you will now become a captive!
translations.text: Zhou Ke cursed: "If you do not quickly surrender to Han, you will now become a captive!

sentences.zh: 若非漢王敵也。」

translations.idiomatic: You are no match for King Han."
translations.text: You are no match for King Han."

sentences.zh: 羽亨周苛，并殺樅公，而虜韓王信，遂圍成皋。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu boiled Zhou Ke and also killed Lord Song. He captured King Han Xin and then surrounded Chenggao.
translations.text: Xiang Yu boiled Zhou Ke and also killed Lord Song. He captured King Han Xin and then surrounded Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 漢王跳，獨與滕公共車出成皋玉門，北 渡河，宿小脩武。

translations.idiomatic: King Han leapt away, alone with Lord Teng sharing a chariot out of Chenggao's Jade Gate. They crossed north over the Yellow River and stayed at Xiao Xiuwu.
translations.text: King Han leapt away, alone with Lord Teng sharing a chariot out of Chenggao's Jade Gate. They crossed north over the Yellow River and stayed at Xiao Xiuwu.

sentences.zh: 自稱使者，晨馳入張耳、韓信壁，而奪之軍。

translations.idiomatic: He called himself an envoy and at dawn galloped into Zhang Er and Han Xin's encampment, seizing command of their army.
translations.text: He called himself an envoy and at dawn galloped into Zhang Er and Han Xin's encampment, seizing command of their army.

sentences.zh: 乃使張耳北收兵趙地。

translations.idiomatic: He then had Zhang Er go north to gather troops in Zhao territory.
translations.text: He then had Zhang Er go north to gather troops in Zhao territory.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，有星孛于大角。

translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, a comet appeared at Dajiao.
translations.text: In the seventh month of autumn, a comet appeared at Dajiao.

sentences.zh: 漢王得韓信軍，復大振。

translations.idiomatic: King Han got Han Xin's army and was greatly strengthened again.
translations.text: King Han got Han Xin's army and was greatly strengthened again.

sentences.zh: 八月，臨河南鄉，軍小脩武，欲復戰。

translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, he faced Henan Xiang, encamped at Xiao Xiuwu, wanting to fight again.
translations.text: In the eighth month, he faced Henan Xiang, encamped at Xiao Xiuwu, wanting to fight again.

sentences.zh: 郎中鄭忠說止漢 王，高壘深塹勿戰。

translations.idiomatic: Attendant Zheng Zhong advised King Han to stop, building high fortifications and deep moats without fighting.
translations.text: Attendant Zheng Zhong advised King Han to stop, building high fortifications and deep moats without fighting.

sentences.zh: 漢王聽其計，使盧綰、劉賈將卒二萬人，騎數百，渡白馬津入楚地，佐彭越燒楚積聚，復擊破楚軍燕郭西，攻下睢陽、外黃十七城。

translations.idiomatic: King Han followed his plan, sending Lu Wan and Liu Jia with 20,000 troops and several hundred cavalry across Baima ford into Chu territory. They assisted Peng Yue in burning Chu's grain stores, then attacked and broke the Chu army west of Yan Guo, capturing Suiyang and Waihuang, 17 cities.
translations.text: King Han followed his plan, sending Lu Wan and Liu Jia with 20,000 troops and several hundred cavalry across Baima ford into Chu territory. They assisted Peng Yue in burning Chu's grain stores, then attacked and broke the Chu army west of Yan Guo, capturing Suiyang and Waihuang, 17 cities.

sentences.zh: 九月，羽謂 海春侯大司馬曹咎曰：「謹守成皋。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, Xiang Yu said to Hai Chun Marquis Grand Marshal Cao Jiu: "Carefully guard Chenggao.
translations.text: In the ninth month, Xiang Yu said to Hai Chun Marquis Grand Marshal Cao Jiu: "Carefully guard Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 即漢王欲挑戰，慎勿與戰，勿令得東而已。

translations.idiomatic: If King Han wants to provoke battle, be careful not to fight him. Just do not let him get east."
translations.text: If King Han wants to provoke battle, be careful not to fight him. Just do not let him get east."

sentences.zh: 我十五日必定梁地，復從將軍。」

translations.idiomatic: Within 15 days I will certainly pacify Liang territory, then follow the general again."
translations.text: Within 15 days I will certainly pacify Liang territory, then follow the general again."

sentences.zh: 羽引兵東擊彭越。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu led troops east to attack Peng Yue.
translations.text: Xiang Yu led troops east to attack Peng Yue.

sentences.zh: 漢王使酈食其說齊王田廣，罷守兵與漢和。

translations.idiomatic: King Han sent Li Yiji to persuade King Qi Tian Guang to dismiss his guarding troops and make peace with Han.
translations.text: King Han sent Li Yiji to persuade King Qi Tian Guang to dismiss his guarding troops and make peace with Han.

sentences.zh: 四年冬十月，韓信用蒯通計，襲破齊。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter in the fourth year, Han Xin used Kuai Tong's plan and attacked, breaking Qi.
translations.text: In the tenth month of winter in the fourth year, Han Xin used Kuai Tong's plan and attacked, breaking Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王亨酈生，東走高密。

translations.idiomatic: King Qi boiled Li Sheng and fled east to Gaomi.
translations.text: King Qi boiled Li Sheng and fled east to Gaomi.

sentences.zh: 項羽聞韓信破齊，且欲擊楚，使龍且救齊。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu heard that Han Xin had broken Qi and was about to attack Chu, so he sent Long Ju to rescue Qi.
translations.text: Xiang Yu heard that Han Xin had broken Qi and was about to attack Chu, so he sent Long Ju to rescue Qi.

sentences.zh: 漢果數挑成皋戰，楚軍不出，使人辱之數日，大司馬咎怒，渡兵汜水。

translations.idiomatic: Han repeatedly provoked battle at Chenggao, but the Chu army did not come out. They sent people to insult them for several days. Grand Marshal Jiu was angry and crossed his troops over Sishui River.
translations.text: Han repeatedly provoked battle at Chenggao, but the Chu army did not come out. They sent people to insult them for several days. Grand Marshal Jiu was angry and crossed his troops over Sishui River.

sentences.zh: 士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國金玉貨賂。

translations.idiomatic: The soldiers were half across when Han attacked them, greatly defeating the Chu army and obtaining all of Chu's gold, jade, and treasures.
translations.text: The soldiers were half across when Han attacked them, greatly defeating the Chu army and obtaining all of Chu's gold, jade, and treasures.

sentences.zh: 大司馬咎、長史欣皆自剄汜水上。

translations.idiomatic: Grand Marshal Jiu and Chief Secretary Xin both committed suicide on the Sishui.
translations.text: Grand Marshal Jiu and Chief Secretary Xin both committed suicide on the Sishui.

sentences.zh: 漢王引兵渡河，復取成皋，軍廣武，就敖倉食。

translations.idiomatic: King Han led troops across the river, recaptured Chenggao, and encamped at Guangwu, drawing provisions from Aocang.
translations.text: King Han led troops across the river, recaptured Chenggao, and encamped at Guangwu, drawing provisions from Aocang.

sentences.zh: 羽下梁地十餘城，聞海春侯破，乃引兵還。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu took over 10 cities in Liang territory. He heard that Hai Chun Marquis was defeated, so he led troops back.
translations.text: Xiang Yu took over 10 cities in Liang territory. He heard that Hai Chun Marquis was defeated, so he led troops back.

sentences.zh: 漢軍方圍鍾離辚於滎陽東，聞羽至，盡走險阻。

translations.idiomatic: The Han army was surrounding Zhongli Mo east of Xingyang. When they heard Xiang Yu had arrived, they all fled to difficult terrain.
translations.text: The Han army was surrounding Zhongli Mo east of Xingyang. When they heard Xiang Yu had arrived, they all fled to difficult terrain.

sentences.zh: 羽亦軍廣武， 與漢相守。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu also encamped at Guangwu and confronted Han.
translations.text: Xiang Yu also encamped at Guangwu and confronted Han.

sentences.zh: 丁壯苦軍旅，老弱罷轉餉。

translations.idiomatic: The able-bodied suffered from military campaigns, the old and weak were exhausted from transporting provisions.
translations.text: The able-bodied suffered from military campaigns, the old and weak were exhausted from transporting provisions.

sentences.zh: 漢王、羽相與臨廣武之間而語。

translations.idiomatic: King Han and Xiang Yu faced each other across Guangwu and spoke.
translations.text: King Han and Xiang Yu faced each other across Guangwu and spoke.

sentences.zh: 羽欲與漢王獨身挑戰，漢王數羽曰：「吾始與羽俱受命懷王，曰先定關中者王之。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu wanted to challenge King Han to single combat. King Han listed Xiang Yu's crimes: "I and Xiang Yu both received commands from King Huai, saying whoever first pacified Guanzhong would be made king.
translations.text: Xiang Yu wanted to challenge King Han to single combat. King Han listed Xiang Yu's crimes: "I and Xiang Yu both received commands from King Huai, saying whoever first pacified Guanzhong would be made king.

sentences.zh: 羽負約，王 我於蜀漢，罪一也。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu broke the agreement and enfeoffed me as king in Shu and Han. This is crime one.
translations.text: Xiang Yu broke the agreement and enfeoffed me as king in Shu and Han. This is crime one.

sentences.zh: 羽矯殺卿子冠軍，自尊，罪二也。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu falsely killed Champion Marquis Qing Bu and exalted himself. This is crime two.
translations.text: Xiang Yu falsely killed Champion Marquis Qing Bu and exalted himself. This is crime two.

sentences.zh: 羽當以救趙還報，而擅劫諸侯兵入關，罪三也。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu should have returned after rescuing Zhao, but instead usurped the feudal lords' troops to enter the passes. This is crime three.
translations.text: Xiang Yu should have returned after rescuing Zhao, but instead usurped the feudal lords' troops to enter the passes. This is crime three.

sentences.zh: 懷王約入秦無暴掠，羽燒秦宮室，掘始皇帝冢，收私其財，罪 四也。

translations.idiomatic: King Huai agreed that entering Qin should not involve violence or plunder, but Xiang Yu burned the Qin palaces, dug up the First Emperor's tomb, and took the treasures for himself. This is crime four.
translations.text: King Huai agreed that entering Qin should not involve violence or plunder, but Xiang Yu burned the Qin palaces, dug up the First Emperor's tomb, and took the treasures for himself. This is crime four.

sentences.zh: 又彊殺秦降王子嬰，罪五也。

translations.idiomatic: He also forcibly killed the Qin surrender prince Zi Ying. This is crime five.
translations.text: He also forcibly killed the Qin surrender prince Zi Ying. This is crime five.

sentences.zh: 詐阬秦子弟新安二十萬，王其將，罪六也。

translations.idiomatic: He deceitfully massacred 200,000 Qin youths at Xin'an and made himself their king. This is crime six.
translations.text: He deceitfully massacred 200,000 Qin youths at Xin'an and made himself their king. This is crime six.

sentences.zh: 皆王諸將善地，而徙逐故主，令臣下爭畔逆，罪七也。

translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed the various generals with good territories but banished and drove out the former lords, causing ministers and subordinates to contend in rebellion. This is crime seven.
translations.text: He enfeoffed the various generals with good territories but banished and drove out the former lords, causing ministers and subordinates to contend in rebellion. This is crime seven.

sentences.zh: 出逐義帝彭城，自都之，奪韓 王地，并王梁楚，多自與，罪八也。

translations.idiomatic: He drove out Righteous Emperor from Pengcheng, established his own capital there, seized the lands of the King of Han, and united the kingships of Liang and Chu, taking most for himself. This is crime eight.
translations.text: He drove out Righteous Emperor from Pengcheng, established his own capital there, seized the lands of the King of Han, and united the kingships of Liang and Chu, taking most for himself. This is crime eight.

sentences.zh: 使人陰殺義帝江南，罪九也。

translations.idiomatic: He sent people to secretly kill Righteous Emperor south of the Jiang. This is crime nine.
translations.text: He sent people to secretly kill Righteous Emperor south of the Jiang. This is crime nine.

sentences.zh: 夫為人臣而殺其主，殺其已降，為政不平，主約不信，天下所不容，大逆無道，罪十也。

translations.idiomatic: To be a minister and kill one's lord, kill those who have already surrendered, administer government unfairly, break covenants without faith - the world cannot tolerate this. Great rebellion without righteousness. This is crime ten.
translations.text: To be a minister and kill one's lord, kill those who have already surrendered, administer government unfairly, break covenants without faith - the world cannot tolerate this. Great rebellion without righteousness. This is crime ten.

sentences.zh: 吾以義兵 從諸侯誅殘賊，使刑餘罪人擊公，何苦乃與公挑戰！」

translations.idiomatic: I lead righteous troops following the feudal lords to execute the cruel and treacherous, using criminals to strike at you. Why must I challenge you to single combat!"
translations.text: I lead righteous troops following the feudal lords to execute the cruel and treacherous, using criminals to strike at you. Why must I challenge you to single combat!"

sentences.zh: 羽大怒，伏弩射中漢王。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was greatly angered and had a crossbow shoot King Han.
translations.text: Xiang Yu was greatly angered and had a crossbow shoot King Han.

sentences.zh: 漢王傷胸，乃捫足曰：「虜中吾指！」

translations.idiomatic: King Han was wounded in the chest, but he patted his foot and said: "The bandit hit my toe!"
translations.text: King Han was wounded in the chest, but he patted his foot and said: "The bandit hit my toe!"

sentences.zh: 漢王病創臥，張良彊請漢王起行勞軍，以安士 卒，毋令楚乘勝。

translations.idiomatic: King Han lay ill from his wound. Zhang Liang strongly urged King Han to rise and go encourage the troops to stabilize the soldiers and officers, not letting Chu take advantage of their victory.
translations.text: King Han lay ill from his wound. Zhang Liang strongly urged King Han to rise and go encourage the troops to stabilize the soldiers and officers, not letting Chu take advantage of their victory.

sentences.zh: 漢王出行軍，疾甚，因馳入成皋。

translations.idiomatic: King Han went out to encourage the troops, but his illness was severe, so he galloped into Chenggao.
translations.text: King Han went out to encourage the troops, but his illness was severe, so he galloped into Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 十一月，韓信與灌嬰擊破楚軍，殺楚將龍且，追至城陽，虜齊王廣。

translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Han Xin and Guan Ying attacked and broke the Chu army, killed Chu general Long Ju, pursued to Chengyang, and captured King Qi Tian Guang.
translations.text: In the eleventh month, Han Xin and Guan Ying attacked and broke the Chu army, killed Chu general Long Ju, pursued to Chengyang, and captured King Qi Tian Guang.

sentences.zh: 齊相田橫自立為齊王，奔彭越。

translations.idiomatic: Qi chancellor Tian Heng established himself as King of Qi and fled to Peng Yue.
translations.text: Qi chancellor Tian Heng established himself as King of Qi and fled to Peng Yue.

sentences.zh: 漢立張耳為趙王。

translations.idiomatic: Han established Zhang Er as King of Zhao.
translations.text: Han established Zhang Er as King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 漢王疾瘉，西入關，至櫟陽，存問父老，置酒。

translations.idiomatic: King Han recovered from his illness, entered the passes to the west, reached Queyang, visited the elders, and held a banquet.
translations.text: King Han recovered from his illness, entered the passes to the west, reached Queyang, visited the elders, and held a banquet.

sentences.zh: 梟故塞王欣頭櫟陽市。

translations.idiomatic: He displayed the head of the former King Sai Xin in Queyang marketplace.
translations.text: He displayed the head of the former King Sai Xin in Queyang marketplace.

sentences.zh: 留四日，復如軍，軍廣武。

translations.idiomatic: He stayed four days, then returned to the army, encamping at Guangwu.
translations.text: He stayed four days, then returned to the army, encamping at Guangwu.

sentences.zh: 關中兵益出，而彭越、田橫居梁地，往來苦楚兵，絕其糧食。

translations.idiomatic: Guanzhong troops came out in greater numbers, while Peng Yue and Tian Heng occupied Liang territory, going back and forth to harass Chu troops and cut off their grain supplies.
translations.text: Guanzhong troops came out in greater numbers, while Peng Yue and Tian Heng occupied Liang territory, going back and forth to harass Chu troops and cut off their grain supplies.

sentences.zh: 韓信已破齊，使人言曰：「齊邊楚，權輕，不為假王，恐不能安齊。」

translations.idiomatic: Han Xin had already broken Qi and sent someone to say: "Qi borders Chu. My authority is light. If not made a puppet king, I fear I cannot pacify Qi."
translations.text: Han Xin had already broken Qi and sent someone to say: "Qi borders Chu. My authority is light. If not made a puppet king, I fear I cannot pacify Qi."

sentences.zh: 漢王怒，欲攻之。

translations.idiomatic: King Han was angry and wanted to attack him.
translations.text: King Han was angry and wanted to attack him.

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「不如 因而立之，使自為守。」

translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang said: "It would be better to take advantage of this and establish him as king, letting him defend it himself."
translations.text: Zhang Liang said: "It would be better to take advantage of this and establish him as king, letting him defend it himself."

sentences.zh: 春二月，遣張良操印，立韓信為齊王。

translations.idiomatic: In the second month of spring, he sent Zhang Liang carrying the seal to establish Han Xin as King of Qi.
translations.text: In the second month of spring, he sent Zhang Liang carrying the seal to establish Han Xin as King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，立黥布為淮南王。

translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, he established Ying Bu as King of Huainan.
translations.text: In the seventh month of autumn, he established Ying Bu as King of Huainan.

sentences.zh: 八月，初為算賦。

translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, he first established poll taxes.
translations.text: In the eighth month, he first established poll taxes.

sentences.zh: 北貉、燕人來致梟騎助漢。

translations.idiomatic: The Beidi and Yan people came to deliver owl-headed cavalry to assist Han.
translations.text: The Beidi and Yan people came to deliver owl-headed cavalry to assist Han.

sentences.zh: 漢王下令：軍士不幸死者， 吏為衣衾棺斂，轉送其家。

translations.idiomatic: King Han issued an order: For soldiers who unfortunately die, officials shall provide burial clothes, coffins, and shrouds, and transport them home.
translations.text: King Han issued an order: For soldiers who unfortunately die, officials shall provide burial clothes, coffins, and shrouds, and transport them home.

sentences.zh: 四方歸心焉。

translations.idiomatic: The four directions turned their hearts to him.
translations.text: The four directions turned their hearts to him.

sentences.zh: 項羽自知少助食盡，韓信又進兵擊楚，羽患之。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu knew he had few helpers and food was exhausted. Han Xin again advanced troops to attack Chu. Xiang Yu was troubled by this.
translations.text: Xiang Yu knew he had few helpers and food was exhausted. Han Xin again advanced troops to attack Chu. Xiang Yu was troubled by this.

sentences.zh: 漢遣陸賈說羽，請太公，羽弗聽。

translations.idiomatic: Han sent Lu Jia to persuade Xiang Yu to return the Duke of Tai. Xiang Yu did not listen.
translations.text: Han sent Lu Jia to persuade Xiang Yu to return the Duke of Tai. Xiang Yu did not listen.

sentences.zh: 漢復使侯公說羽，羽乃 與漢約，中分天下，割鴻溝以西為漢，以東為楚。

translations.idiomatic: Han again sent Hou Gong to persuade Xiang Yu. Xiang Yu then made a treaty with Han to divide the world in half, giving Honggou west to Han and east to Chu.
translations.text: Han again sent Hou Gong to persuade Xiang Yu. Xiang Yu then made a treaty with Han to divide the world in half, giving Honggou west to Han and east to Chu.

sentences.zh: 九月，歸太公、呂后，軍皆稱萬歲。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, he returned the Duke of Tai and Empress Lü. The army all shouted ten thousand years.
translations.text: In the ninth month, he returned the Duke of Tai and Empress Lü. The army all shouted ten thousand years.

sentences.zh: 乃封侯公為平國君。

translations.idiomatic: He then enfeoffed Hou Gong as Lord of Pingguo.
translations.text: He then enfeoffed Hou Gong as Lord of Pingguo.

sentences.zh: 羽解而東歸。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu withdrew and returned east.
translations.text: Xiang Yu withdrew and returned east.

sentences.zh: 漢王欲西歸，張良、陳平諫曰：「今漢有天 下太半，而諸侯皆附，楚兵罷食盡，此天亡之時，不因其幾而遂取之，所謂養虎自遺患也。」

translations.idiomatic: King Han wanted to return west. Zhang Liang and Chen Ping advised: "Now Han possesses more than half the world, and all the feudal lords are attached. Chu troops are exhausted and food is finished. This is the time Heaven has doomed them. If we do not take advantage of this opportunity to destroy them, this is called raising a tiger that brings disaster to oneself."
translations.text: King Han wanted to return west. Zhang Liang and Chen Ping advised: "Now Han possesses more than half the world, and all the feudal lords are attached. Chu troops are exhausted and food is finished. This is the time Heaven has doomed them. If we do not take advantage of this opportunity to destroy them, this is called raising a tiger that brings disaster to oneself."

sentences.zh: 漢王從之。

translations.idiomatic: King Han followed their advice.
translations.text: King Han followed their advice.
